He falls in with the dark and sinister crowd, gets in over his head, and then the reader is subjected to he and Tragarde running into each other and there's a lot of staring across a crowded room and other dreamy-eyed (and dreamy-thought-process) nonsense.  I actually got so tired of not seeing the main character (or who I thought the main character was) do anything and being forced to follow the incredibly dull back story that I just gave up.  I'm certainly not willing to give up on Lackey, but this may be the last of this series for me.

This was a pretty good read overall.  I thought that the main character of Elise was interesting in a prickly way, but I also saw plenty of room for growth (which the author seemed successful in doing).  There were some secondary characters that had appeal, though the romance angle seemed to be thrown in at random because . . . well, these books are supposed to have romances, right?  The action was plentiful and well thought out, and there was never any part of the book that dragged (which is pretty impressive considering the glut of urban fantasy books out there).  The ending was a good setup for a second novel and gave the author lots of paths to follow.There were two big problems for me that kept this book from getting a slightly higher rating.  The first were how the flashback sequences were integrated.  The author attempted to tell some of the back story through chapter-long flashbacks that are interspersed at odd intervals throughout the book, and it really kept me from getting a good rhythm going while reading.  Also, I was really confused as to what exactly Elise was supposed to be (or what the source of her powers was).  She was obviously a more-than-she-appears heroine, but the author really didn't do a good job of explaining why (or even giving any hints that made sense).  Still, there was enough there to draw me in for round 2, which is more than a lot of these series has been able to do.

I'm almost surprised at how much I liked the second installment of the series.  There were a few issues to be sure, but the main character has an abundance of actual personality (and most of it is actually likable!), the dialogue is sharp and clever, and the secondary characters are interesting.  Heck, I'd be happy to read an entire novel about Kate's assistant, who is the (semi) living embodiment of the "straight man" (in comedic terms).  There's a good overarching story line that actually kept me engaged for the majority of the story.  I also like the ongoing "Kate's Obituary" jokes that continued from the first book.One problem that I had was that there was a plot-line toward the beginning that seemed like it was going to be major and then really wasn't in that it just sort of resolved itself and wound up not seeming to have a major impact on the big conflict.  Also, while once was all right, I found it rather weird that Kate Kane was apparently still attracted to ALL of her exes, all of whom showed up in this book.  Hopefully in the next novel (and I hope there will be one), we can look forward a bit more toward Kate's future and less about her past.

While I think the idea behind this book wasn't bad, the delivery wasn't quite there.  The notion of controlled chaos or chaos magic was an interesting one, but the author wasn't quite successful in explaining what it was (at least not to my satisfaction).  The action jumped from incident to incident, but didn't flow very well overall.  There were several dead-end streets in regard to plot directions (the author would pursue a particular avenue that really didn't feel like it went anywhere), and then the character is back home again with the feeling that the reader is starting over.  You are able to see the participants in the final conflict coming a mile away.  Also, none of the characters really have much of a personality except MAYBE the best friend, and even that wound up seeming like more of cartoon that a real character.  Throw in a romance that seemed to be added simply because these books usually have one, and you wind up with a good idea that really fails to differentiate itself in most ways from the thousands of other straight-to-ebook urban fantasy novels that are out there.

I have to admit that I see most of this author's works as falling into the guilty pleasure: an almost fluffy combination of softcore erotica and sci-fi/fantasy geek fun.  Doing a superhero(ine) sequence is right up Teasdale's alley.  I get more fun out of them than most books at this price, that's for sure.Unfortunately, I did have some issues with this book.  First, the perspective shifts (bouncing from one character to another) happen way too often, making it really hard to get any kind of rhythm going while reading the book.  It was a big complaint that I had toward the end of the Aneka Jansen series, which I hoped the author had outgrown.  With two main characters and a couple of secondary characters all getting face time, it got . . . well, not difficult, but frustrating at time to follow the action.  Also, while the tension between the primary main character and her roommate was inevitable, it wasn't handled as well as it was in the Thaumatology books and felt very glossed over at the end.  Also, there were a lot of secondary characters that were introduced that didn't seem to fulfill a real purpose, and it would probably be better for the author to really develop the primaries and then save the plethora of other ultras for later.Still, overall, I found it to be an intriguing enough setup (particularly for the price) that I'll probably give the series another chance.  Hopefully the author will stop the perspective bouncing or at least tone it down, because that's the most problematic element that I found so far.

I personally did not experience any results or effects from taking this supplement. It just didn't do anything noticeable for me. The pill itself is small, and comes in a clear capsule with white powder inside of it. The pills are easy to swallow and do not have any taste. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Linda Larsen's "The Complete Slow Cooking for Two" cookbook is an excellent introduction to creative slow-cooked meals. The dishes in this cookbook will be familiar to Americans, but that doesn't mean it doesn't include some interesting dishes from other cultures because it does--there are Indian and Korean recipes, too.If you don't have a lot of time, or would like to spend less time cooking, this is the book for you. The range of dishes in it will prepare you to be able to translate recipes not geared towards slow cookers into tried and true slow-cooker recipes. Larsen sets up the cookbook with stories from couples in different situations who needed to cook for two and eventually ended up relying on their slow cooker and it changed the way they ate for the better. This book is great because you can relate to the stories and it just serves to reinforce that you are not alone in not wanting or being able to spend a lot of time cooking, and that is great motivation to keep at the slow cooking until it becomes second nature.I like that Larsen goes over "layering" quite a bit to emphasize the importance of the order in which you place the ingredients in your slow cooker so you end up with the right texture of ingredients, and everything cooks the way it should. For example--putting small veggies like corn at the top to keep them from getting soggy. That's a great tip.This is a big cookbook with a lot of great recipes to get you started. I like that it made grocery shopping easier for me, because I just look at the recipes for the week and go with the ingredients on the list. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Marye Audet has done a fabulous job with the Mexican Slow Cooker Cookbook. This book has changed the way I approach the food I prepare at home. Thanks to this book, I have been been seeking out more interesting and flavorful cultural recipes from around the world.Mexican is by far my favorite kind of food. Audet's Cookbook is full of quick, easy, fool-proof recipes that cover all the basic traditional (or maybe just popular in the US) Mexican dishes. What I like about this Cookbook is its layout: It is easy to read, and formatted in a consistent manner. I also really love that the text is colorful. All of the ingredients pop against the rest of the page in a beautiful turquoise. This is great because when I'm reading a recipe, I like to easily find the measurements of the ingredients while I'm reading the steps to take. The format of the book as a whole is that it is divided up into what part of which meal the dish would be served in: Entres, Desserts, Breakfast, etc.I'm not a skilled chef, or even cook of any kind. I was cooking boring staple dishes before getting this cookbook, and only pulled out my slow cooker once every other month or so. I never really thought I could create delicious and complex dishes that I would be proud to serve any guest. Now, I think of all sorts of things I can make in my slow cooker, not just Mexican, but all types of food. This book is a good primer in that way because you learn how to layer things in your slow cooker, which is a skill you can apply to any recipe.I highly recommend the Mexican Slow Cooker Cookbook to anyone who likes quick, easy, fool-proof and delicious meals. I think that's most people! I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This mouse was very close to getting a 5-star rating for me, if it were not for one tiny detail that makes a big enough difference to irritate me almost constantly when using this mouse. On the scroll wheel, there's a lip of plastic that seems like was accidentally fused onto the wheel, so when scrolling with the wheel, once a revolution I hit this bump of plastic that really irritates me. It's a rather shallow or short mouse, as it's more flat than rounded. I did not have any problems with the connection or using the mouse. I probably just got a bad one with the plastic on the wheel. This is now my travel mouse that I take with me on weekends away from home to visit my parents. That way, if I leave it there I'm not as irritated, and I only have to use it for a short period of time so the bump also kind of limits how much time I want to spend on the computer versus with my family. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Lucentee's large ice ball maker was the perfect gift for my whiskey-loving, whisky aficionado boyfriend. At first he thought this was just some junk I bought. Until I made a batch, he saw me drinking my drink with an ice ball in it, and the light bulb went off in his head that this is perfect for whisky because of the rate at which it melts, and how it maximizes its surface area. You have to make sure you really get a tight seal for the ice balls to come out perfectly round, and even then, it's hard to fill it up to the top so that none spills out and you don't have a little flat part at the top when the water hardens into ice. Overall, I'm very pleased with this product. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
Uh....MAZING!!!

Arvazallia's Hydrating Argan Oil Hair Mask and Deep Conditioner has been really good for my dried out, bleach blonde 'do. After leaving this in over night, I rinsed it out and my hair was SO soft. Like "buttah." It smells good which is always a plus. The product itself is white so I didn't have to worry about it staining my bleached blonde hair. It smells great, feels great and works great. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
Instantaneous!

This sleep mask is surprisingly thick, soft and contoured so it doesn't smush your eyelashes against your eyes while you are wearing it. However, I have two complaints: 1. It has a chemical smell. Air it out for a day before using it. But, I want to wash it and am afraid it will lose it's good qualities and get thin and flimsy if I do that, so I haven't tried it yet. 2. The nose part is really wide. My nose is average in the bridge, and slightly wider than average at the nostrils, and I had to pull this mask down to my nostrils to try to block out more light, but still a little shown through and then it was sitting below my eyebrows which I didn't like. But, overall, I like this mask a lot. The adjustable straps are a great feature, and besides the nose thing, it's really good at blocking out all light. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a nice headband. I like the knot at the top. I don't love the silver charm that sort of ends up near the ear or in front of it a little bit. But, I just tuck it under and no one can see it. If it really bothers you, you can easily cut it off the headband. It's comfortable, soft and stays on well. I can certainly recommend this headband to anyone who thinks it's cute. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a great heating blanket. Unlike other blankets, this one connects by USB. That makes it easy to plug in on the go. The fleece is super soft and comfy. The actual heating unit is smaller then the width of the blanket, which really just fits on your lap. The blanket is rectangular, like the size of a hand towel, maybe a little larger. The heating component is square, you can feel it inside the blanket.Definitely don't sleep with this plugged in, but if you're cold and paying attention to it, it's a good heating blanket. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

The iVog pedi-luv callus remover is compact yet powerful. It comes with refills for the spinning roller part which is useful. I like this product because it makes the process of getting really smooth feet super quick and easy and painless. No more scrubbing and scrubbing to slough away rough skin. If you press too hard it will stop the roller from working but you will get the hang of using it at the right pressure. It helps of course if your feet have been soaking in hot water and are soft before using this. I would not recommend using it on hard dry skin. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love the Ozeri digital kitchen scale. The white color makes it different from other kitchen scales I've used in the past. I prefer the white color because I can clearly see if I missed any spots when cleaning it. The surface is smooth and easy to clean.  The scale itself is easy to use and very easy to read. I like that there are two ways to read the scale. Taring the scale to get an accurate reading is important to do before each use and it only takes a few seconds. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

If you're buying this product, you should be aware already that it is a cheesy decoration. It's not going to make your party look like a million dollars. But, if this is the look you are going for, then this is the right product for you. My only qualm with it is that it comes folded up so the folds can be seen and there's no good way to get the creases out. Besides that, it's good for a party, or a one-time use. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

With the Super Z Outlet Hawaiian Luau Hibiscus and Green String table decoration, what you see is what you get. The product is consistent with the product photo provided. It's not very fancy, but if this is the look you are going for, like I said, what you see is what you get, so you should be content with your purchase. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These are great marbles. I got these to make art with, so the variation and colors didn't necessarily matter to me. But, still, they are pretty. I dip the marbles into different colors of paint and then put a sheet of paper at the bottom of a box. Then I place the marbles inside the box on top of the paper and roll them around. It's a great activity to do with kids as young as 4-5 years old, under adult supervision. I can recommend these marbles to others. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These Survivor Filter Collapsible Canteens are very large. I like that the plastic material is strong enough to hold the liquid in, but flexible enough to fold up as well. They are quite easy to fill and to drink out of. I can definitely recommend this product to others. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Chef Essential's Stainless Steel Mixing Bowls are superb. The quality of these bowls is just fantastic. I love the rubber/silicone on the bottom of each bowl so it does not slide around on the surface while I'm mixing. The bowls nest perfectly together, saving storage space in my cabinet. They are easy to clean. I can highly recommend this set of mixing bowls to others. I purchased this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is an interesting product. I thought it worked differently than the way it does, before I got the product and used it. It sticks to the top of your bowl because it has a series of rings that are about 1/2 inch apart, so if you stretch it, the rings catch on the outside of the bowl and are supposed to stay put. But if you have anything slick around the edges of the bowl, you'll see it slip off, so make sure the bowl is dry around the rim before using this product. It comes with a few of these in different sizes so you can use a bunch at one time. I purchased this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This books has its strengths and weaknesses. To make things simple, here's my list:STRENGTHS:Full color screenshotsIt's a workbookVisually engaging, except for the font.WEAKNESSES:Not enough examples - it says things like "what value does your business offer?" without giving examples for those who are just starting out building a small businessVery dryPretty boringIt's a workbook - if you use it as you learn you need to use pencil to erase your old answers.It doesn't feel like a workbook - It feels too small and nice to write all over. An online workbook would be more helpfulIf you do not have business acumen or coding experience, this book is not going to help you. If you sort of already know what you're doing and would like a book to guide you or remind you on what to do, then this is a good book for you. However, if you're already at that level, I wonder why you wouldn't be able to find your answers online, through WordPress help, chat or other forums, but maybe that's just me.Overall, I feel as though this particular book doesn't explain enough in detail. The workbook aspect asks a lot of questions without guiding you towards the best fitting answer for your situation. If you do well with that sort of learning, and are a "big-picture" person, then I strongly encourage you to purchase this book.  I received this book in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

WordPress for Dummies is like an encyclopedia for all of WordPress because it covers so many topics! I can't name a topic this book doesn't cover. Well, it doesn't go over every plug-in, but it does go over the ten most popular which is helpful because once you get a handle on those, you can get a feel for not only how to use plug-ins, but to figure out which ones you might want or need for your site. And this example demonstrates how I see the book. It gives you all the fundamentals you need and goes over the basics so you know how to navigate WordPress.What I found most difficult about WordPress before reading this book was figuring out how to make my website shine without paying for all the easy add-ons. Having read this book, I feel a lot more comfortable managing my site and even helping others with their websites. The step-by-step "how to" instructions are great. The books tells you which urls to enter and where to find what you need to click on next to get what you need done. I won't say I'm a WordPress expert, but now I know a whole lot more, and I know what I don't know, as opposed to before when I didn't even have a clue as to what I needed to learn to "make things go."This book is well-written, which makes it easy to read and follow along on my computer. Instructions are detailed yet clear. I can recommend this book to anyone starting out on WordPress as a great place to start to cover all your bases. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I took Financial Accounting in business school as an undergrad. There were over 100 students in my section, which was one of three taught by the professor that semester. There were over a dozen TA's. Let's just say I didn't learn much from that class. I was reluctant to dive back into accounting after that experience, but I have to help run my father's business as he's getting older.This book has been so helpful. It's a friendly introduction to accounting that just tells you the important stuff you need to know to keep your business on track. It explains what different kinds of statements are and when to use them. In college, it was like I was getting papers and balance sheets thrown my way and I was ducking out of the way, and couldn't make sense of how to put what I was learning together to actually be USEFUL in the world.Accounting for Small Business Owners is great because it uses plain language that is easy to understand, with lots of examples to learn from. There are sample statements in the book to show you what these documents should look like, which I find really helpful. Reading this book is like sitting down with a friend who happens to be an accountant who explains things really well. It's amazing how simple this stuff can be when it's explained the right way. I can definitely recommend this book to others. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

These headphones block out a lot of sound! The first few times I wore them I could hear NOTHING unless I pulled one out. I guess my ears have gotten more used to them because now on the subway I hear faint sounds, but that's only when the sound is off. So, these work as great ear plugs in addition to earphones! I haven't had any trouble with talking on them with my iPhone. The sound comes through clear and there's no feedback. Plus, I love that they don't tangle! I recommend these earphones. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This product is good if you're in a pinch, don't have power, live off grid, and things like that. It is a manual (hand operated) food chopper that spins when you pull a string that is attached to the top of the chopper. It has a replaceable blade and blender. The blender doesn't work great unless what you've got is already liquid or close to it and you want to mix those things. It works best with boiled, baked or otherwise soft fruit and vegetables. I would probably try to cut something like an apple as small or thin as possible before putting it in here. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This soft bonnet comes with a matching vinyl bag with zipper to store it in. The bonnet, yes, is big and ridiculous looking while you're wearing it, but when you're done using it, your hair will look fabulous and no one will be laughing then! The chin strap keeps the bonnet from flying away. It could be slightly more comfortable, but its not bad. Follow the instructions and keep your hair dryer on low so you don't burn yourself. Seriously. I can recommend this bonnet to anyone looking for one to do their hair at home, or when traveling. I purchased this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This shirt is so soft and comfortable. I think the sizes will accommodate a large range of sizes. I ordered the biggest size (4X) and normally wear 1 or 2X in tops and jackets. With that said, it's a good idea to check the size chart before ordering. I love how comfortable and good looking this shirt is. I really have no complaints. As soon as I got it I wanted to wear it and never take it off. The colors are true to the picture, and I would say look nicer in person. I purchased this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a good, strong weight lifting belt. My only qualm with it is that it is not tall enough from top to bottom for my torso. I'm 5'9". Other than that, I'm happy with this belt and can recommend it to others if this is the style of belt you like. I think it's wide enough to accommodate the "average" person. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

AmaziPro8's iPhone Charging station works very well and looks nice. I like that you can use it without taking the case off of your phone, if it's not a particularly thick case. I use a clear silicone flexible case and it works great. It connects via USB so you can plug it into your laptop, for example. It doesn't take up much room and sits firmly on any flat surface. It's nice to be able to see my notifications when I'm not handling my phone, or atleast to see the time on the phone screen. It's a great way to turn your phone into your alarm clock by putting it on your bedside table. I purchased this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like this coffee and I'm usually not a huge fan of dark roasts. It has a round and mellow taste. I like my coffee with a lot of milk and this creates a creamy and delicious coffee. I appreciate that it comes in whole bean form so I can grind my coffee fresh when I am ready to make a new batch. I also like my coffee iced so I make a pot and stick the rest in the fridge which lasts me that day and the next. It tastes great hot or cold. I think this is a great coffee for everyone! I reviewed this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love the Calily Ultrasonic Essential Oil diffuser. It's really pretty and I love the colors that it glows. It works to put the scent into the air for hours. It's great that it lasts a long time so I don't have to keep refilling it throughout the day or night. It is easy to fill, clean (not really necessary unless you use too much essential oil) and refill. This is so easy to use and can make a bad or ordinary day so much better from aromatherapy! I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love this lotion. I'd love to know if there is a difference in the formulation between this and the psoriasis lotion. It's thick--solid but soft like it's been whipped. It's not runny at all. I use it everyday, wherever my skin feels dry--usually my hands, but it's gentle enough yet still thick enough to wear as a primer under my makeup. I love everything about this, including the soft scent it has, sort of like honey but not as sweet. This lasts a pretty long time as you don't need to use too much. I give this lotion my highest recommendation. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Magnum Solace's dead sea magnesium oil is crystal clear and great for a number of uses. I use this to massage my feet on nights when I can afford to oversleep, like on the weekends because I end up getting tired within the hour and sleeping really soundly that night. I can recommend this both for improving sleep as well as for muscle relief. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love this rose water mist toner. It smells amazing. The scent is not too overbearing, and it smells very authentic. It feels great when I mist it on my face. It makes me feel like I'm really treating myself well and luxuriously when I use it. It definitely helps my skin clear up. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

It's kind of complicated to put the pieces of this belt together before you read the instructions. But it's well-made and durable. It's adjustable and made of good quality, strong materials. I was a little apprehensive before the first time I used this, but it's easy to use and get used to quickly. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Gardencense's natural shoe deodorizer smells great! I have two other natural sprays like this one, and they both smells exactly the same, but this one smells a bit different and I really like it. It's almost like it has wintergreen in it. That might not be it, but I can't put my finger on it. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These are good precision tweezers. Only the very tip of the tweezers touch. If you are used to using  this kind of tweezers, these will be a good choice for you. They're strong and well-made tweezers. I'm glad I got these. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a great, really large jar of coconut oil. It's best if you have a long thin spoon to get the coconut oil out of the jar since the mouth of the jar is smaller than the body of the jar. This coconut oil is pretty sensitive to temperature. When it's warm in the late summer/early fall, there's a ring of liquid coconut oil around the solid bit in the middle. When it's colder, it's completely solid. I received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is great quality organ oil! I am used to organ oil treatments that don't really make a difference after 3-15 minutes. So, I left this in my hair overnight and oh my, I was really pleased with the results. My bleached blonde hair was amazingly soft and silky and hydrated when I washed it out in the morning. If anything, it worked too well and I had to do a bit more rinsing than I normally do. Next time, I'll just leave this on for a few minutes since I trust that it works. I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I have a large collection of washi tape. I can vouch that this is good quality washi tape. It sticks well and the patterns look good. It is a little bit see-through on the white parts--kind of like it's frosted. I have had this washi tape stuck to the top part of my laptop keyboard where the fans get hot underneath it. The tape hasn't peeled or come off and it's been almost two weeks. The colors are pretty, too. I can recommend this washi tape. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

For a moisturizer in a jar, this one is thick, but still kind of liquid. I really like the way this moisturizer smells. It kind of reminds me of summer or sunscreen. It works as a great primer underneath my makeup, and that's usually how I use it. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Purchased this cheaply made piece of luggage through Amazon Warehouse deals.  Write up said it was in good condition with 10% cosmetic damage.  I figured it would have at least that after one trip, so went ahead and purchased it.  The luggage came in a banged up box, which caused me some concern.  When I opened it, I was shocked.  The luggage was filthy - looked like it was at least five year's old, with dark dirty stains and apparent repeated liquid spills all over it, and, to make matters even worse, the zipper to the main compartment was completely broken, leaving the luggage unuseable (not that I would have used it in this condition anyway).  I couldn't believe Amazon Warehouse would send this to anyone!  So disappointing.  The luggage itself was very cheaply made.  Immediately returned it.
Fashionable, extremely comfortable and great arch support.  I just love them!  I also want to mention that the footbed is very easy to wash with antibacterial soap.

Read other reviews that said product runs small, so I ordered an XX.  Fits to a T.  Love the lacy back and the material is very soft.  I'm 5/7", so I don't quite understand the people who say it is too short; length is perfect for me.  Actually buying a couple more dresses from 2LUV.

It rather small but the sound is pleasant.  The packaging was good and each bell was individually wrapped.  The centers ball were not lined up properly with the bells, so I very gently but firmly had to move them down about 1/2 inch or so.  The sound is pleasant enough but it is very quiet and takes a bit of a breeze to move them.  I will keep them but I'm not that impressed.  I also purchased the Aloha purple passion chimes made by Woodstock at the same time - they are far superior (but the sound is different, of course).
Had an old case that had just worn down a bit too much and liked the look of this, although I was hesitant because of the price.  It is well made, fits perfectly and is working out very well.

Beautiful sound and well made.  I just love the sound that emirates from the Purple Passion Aloha Chime.  It really does give me an Aloha feeling.  Have it hanging from the overhand at the entry to my front porch.
Mild scent, easy to use.  During the week, I wipe down my mask with Citrus II wipes and do a thorough cleaning on the weekend.  They work well and the scent is very mild.
Our favorite sugar, and Amazon usually has a good price on it.  It's raw and tasty.
Great magazine with lots of useful information for people who are interested in do it yourself project.  I will definitely renew my subscription.

I love PattyBoutik and have several of their tops and dresses.  This one was just too tight all over - it's the only thing I've ever bought from them that didn't fit well.  I passed it on to my daughter who is thinner than me.
Purchased this for my husband to wear at a Flapper inspired event.  It fit perfectly and looked very nice.  Price was great and quality was very good.
Very easy to set up and link to several computers.  The feeder is easy to use as well.  I am 100% happy with this purchase.
Very nice.  perfect fit.  Held up all night without saying or running.  Great purchase.
These boots are beautiful and very stylish, but they were far too narrow in the toes.  I had to return them.
I purchased this because of the great reviews.  It's Easy to use but the sound is just not loud enough.  Would not buy again.
Easy to set and works quite well on the gym lockers.  Great buy.
Stylish and comfortable, with a large enough face that the time is easily seen.  Very satisfied with my purchase.
Purchases this through Warehouse deals at a fantastic price.  Love the bag.  Perfect size for my gym clothes and shoes, and it looks great in grey and yellow.
This was the most boring Leslie DVD that I own.  Not worth $5.
This was expensive at more than $50, but it's what I wanted.  Fits perfect, looks great, very comfortable, and I had no problem washing it.

Surprised by the number of positive reviews, this is a pretty mediocre BBQ tool in my opinion.  I was looking for something to give me better control at handling burgers after using a friend's hybrid spatula-tongs, a tool I thought looked quite gimmicky until I used it.  I had high hopes for this product given the positive reviews.With this version however, the handle isn't long enough to protect you from direct heat, and the spatula section isn't wide enough to really function as a spatula.  It isn't any better at handling delicate items like loosely compressed burger patties than a decent set of normal BBQ tongs.I will keep looking, and this will likely fall to the back of my utensil drawer.  It's not a poorly made product, just doesn't function any better than a standalone spatula or tongs and the handle is too short to use over high temp direct heat (I use Meathead's reverse sear from amazing ribs, with very high direct heat at the end).

I travel quite a bit and thought this would be useful for hotels.  I don't view something like this as a high security lock, rather as something to prevent someone with a key (i.e. at a hotel, where LOTS of staff have access to your room, or in a rental situation, where again depending on the situation numerous people could have keys such as apartment staff or former tenants and anyone those people shared a key with) from easily or non-forcefully entering an occupied dwelling.I traveled with this only once, but concluded this isn't going to work for me.  The first problem is in the product design itself - the cutout for the door latch is far too small to fit the latches that seem to be common at commercial building such as hotels, which are larger than typical residential latches.  The cutout seems sized more for what you encounter on a residential door.  So for hotels that were built or renovated within say the last 25 years, I think this is not going to fit the latch in the majority of cases.The second problem was, when I was returning home, the TSA wanted to open my carry on bag after running it through the belt.  I got a good look at the screen and this does looks like it could easily be confused with a weapon to the TSA personnel.  I didn't end up having a problem, but I prefer to get through security as quickly and efficiently as possible and having them open my bag is a big inconvenience for me.  You could take it out along w/ your liquids etc. and place separately on the belt, but this is also an added inconvenience.  Granted, I am going on a sample size of only 2 (one flight out when it didn't result in my bag getting searched, the return flight where it did), but based on what it looked like on the screen I could see this being a problem regularly.So, we have a product that 1) isn't going to fit the majority of hotel doors, and 2) is likely to delay you in getting through airport security.  Combined these two issues make this an unviable product as a travel/hotel lock, in my opinion.  I give it 2 stars instead of 1 as I could see that for renters in say an apartment, if this happens to fit your door, it could be useful for you although in that situation you'd be better off asking your landlord if you can pay to change out or rekey your lock.  For my intended (and apparently a lot of peoples') intended use for hotels, it's of quite limited use and a potential travel hassle in my opinion.

I live in a 3-story contemporary house with a lot of windows, many of which are high up and/or at odd angles ... basically an out of work professional window washers' wet dream.  Before hiring a pro, I decided to order this along with some ettore products (18" squeegees, washer, their concentrated washing solution, the bucket, and the scraper).I found this to be highly useful, and I was able to clean all of my windows myself.  Using this extension pole, I was able to reach windows up to my 2nd story without the use of a ladder, although I did have to use my ladder for some third story windows.  I was afraid the angle would be odd squeegeeing with this fully or mostly extended but that wasn't the case.  I was even able to effectively use the scraper attached to this on some second story windows.I did not have any difficulty retracting this back in after use, as some other reviewers have noted.  That said, because I had read their reviews, I took special care not to lock it in to tight - you do not have to tighten it very much!  Err on the side of less tight, and if that doesn't lock it in place gradually and gently tighten further.  To be fair I have only used this once so far, but I used it on my entire exterior of my house so there was quite a bit of extending and retracting involved.  I only used this on the exterior of my house, as I felt using the method of the ettore washer dipped in a bucket of solution results in way too much water dripping everywhere than I'd want inside, so for inside I filled a spray bottle w/ the diluted ettore solution, sprayed it on and squeegeed off.

I'd have looked at quite a number of products for secure but quickly accessible firearms storage, and I came to the conclusion that the simplex style locks are probably the best available lock type for this application as they are reasonably secure, quick and simple to access including in the dark and/or under stress, and reliable.  I personally would not trust anything with an electronic lock for any firearm I keep for defensive purposes.  Many of the locking mechanisms on competing quick access "safes" are pretty insecure, google deviant ollam's video "safe to armed in seconds" although to be fair he doesn't review any simplex type lock products.  Finally, the configurability of the simplex combinations, which have the option of including multiple buttons at a time, gives the user the option of choosing a more simple code or a more complicated one depending on need (i.e. if you don't have kids and thus don't need much security, you could make a very simple one or two button press "combination").This container is reasonably well constructed and size wise provides a good balance of interior space vs. compactness.  It easily fits an AR style carbine w/ red dot optic with enough room for a holstered handgun, a few mags, backup flashlight etc.  It would similarly fit a typical defensive type shotgun (i.e. 18-20" barrel).  Security wise keep in mind any of these quick access safes are intended mainly to keep guns out of unauthorized hands (i.e. children, or an intruder from quickly accessing your gun) for the purposes of preventing an accident, they are a compromise between security and the ability to access quickly, and consequently they are not high security "safes" designed to prevent theft although if bolted down would be much better than nothing.As far as I know, for long guns, this is the best product I'm aware of currently on the market.  For handguns, I prefer the FAS1 product which utilizes the same simplex style Illinois lock but is much more solidly constructed.  I own both products and I consider it a big advantage that both use the same lock type (I have them programmed with the same combo).  5 because I think this is the best product out there, although the construction is good but not great.  I'd love to see a better constructed FAS1 type product in this size, although it would be significantly heavier and more expensive (which is why I don't deduct a star, for the price I think this is as good a product as one can reasonably expect).

I recently did a garage organization project and looked at a number of gladiator products.  For cabinets, I ended up getting Newage pro over the gladiator product as the gladiators look a little cheap/cheasy to me and they don't have much interior space due to lack of depth, and a lack of height on their taller cabinets.For shelves though, the gladiator product looked like a winner.  I ordered and am very happy with them.  They are very sturdy, deep enough to be quite useful, and extremely easy to assemble, requiring no tools.  It recommends 2 people to assemble, but I did it myself no problem.The only caveat I'd mention is,  I was in Costco yesterday and they had what appears to be an extremely similar shelf (possibly the same thing?  The brackets under the shelves looked slightly different) for quite a bit cheaper than these.  I would probably consider that as an alternative if I was buying these.  That said, I'm still quite happy w/ the Gladiator, and getting them delivered to my house was more convenient than lugging it home would be.

I have a 2gig alarm panel/system and use it along with Alarm.com for various alerts etc.  This review is from the perspective of someone who has and uses a 2gig alarm panel.This is a very useful product, integrating your doorbell to the alarm panel.  This has 2 useful features - first, it allows the chime to go through your alarm panel speakers, which is very useful if, like me, your existing doorbell can't be heard through the entire house.  I can now hear the doorbell anywhere, even if I'm in the shower etc.  Second, it allows you to set up alerts via alarm.com, for example you could receive a text message, an email, or a push notification via the alarm.com smartphone app whenever the doorbell rings.The only negative about this, and the reason for 4 stars rather than 5, is that IMO it's kind of ugly and cheap looking.  If it was made out of say aluminum and available in a choice of white or black that would be a huge improvement aesthetically., although even a higher quality looking plastic would be an improvement.  It does light up, which is a nice touch, and it's dim enough to not appear lit during the day but is quite visible but not annoyingly bright at night.

I had a great Cuisinart toaster oven (Cusinart TOB-40, http://www.amazon.com/Cuisinart-TOB-40-Classic-Toaster-Broiler/dp/B004JMZGM2/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1434205776&sr=8-1&keywords=cuisinart+toaster+oven) that recently started to die after 3 1/2 years, and while I was in Costco my girlfriend talked me into replacing it with this Kitchenmaid model.  Ignoring my better judgement, which told me to either order an identical Cusinart or go home and scour thousands of Amazon reviews in search of the best toaster oven on earth, I agreed as this did look like a fairly nice toaster oven.And in fact, it is a fairly nice toaster oven - although it's a bit bigger than I'd like, it looks and feels like a good product, it's got plenty of features, it has simple analog controls etc.  It should be a perfectly acceptable replacement to my Cuisinart.Except for one fatal flaw - this thing takes FOREVER to make toast.  Forever.  Every Saturday morning, I face the excruciating dilemma of whether to allow my eggs to continue to get cold while I wait for this hunk of s*** to finish my toast, or take out the still-untoasted-despite-having-been-toasting for 10 minutes bread and eat it that way, or eat my eggs before my toast and then wait another 3 hours for toast.Some may think 1 star is too harsh for an otherwise decent product - but this thing is a toaster oven, and a somewhat high end toaster oven at that, that fails miserably at it's core task of making toast.  Avoid this.  Unless you need a the size, get the Cusinart instead, it's cheaper and vastly superior.
The pounder - I don't buy these on Amazon but they are good pretzels.  Be careful not to break a tooth, they're pretty hard.
Short and sweet.  Timeless self defense principles.

Very good hot sauce.  Normally I just use tabasco and when I try other hot sauces, don't think they are as good.  But this stuff is good enough to earn a coveted spot in my pantry.  Has a bit more flavor and thicker texture than tabasco.  Great on tacos, burritos, and most anything else that could use some hot sauce.

Go to a webite called amazing ribs dot com.  Read his articles about thermometers (really, read all of his articles but thermos in particular).  Then buy this thermo, along with a thermapen Splash-Proof Super-Fast Thermapen (Yellow) Instant Read Thermometer, Perfect for Barbecue, Home and Professional Cooking and you're all set.  Yes this seems like an expensive combo, but it's worth it.One probe goes in the meat.  The other probe goes in your grill/BBQ/Egg (could probably use in your oven, too) to tell you the temp inside there.  You can use both probes together (meat + grill), or either one individually (just meat temp or just grill temp).  Pretty simple concept.This Maverick thermometer combo has changed the way I grill and BBQ, and I've been grilling for a long time.  It's kind of eye opening in that I feel like a moron for not using one of these for the previous 10 years - it's like driving with your eyes closed in comparison.  I now consider a probe thermometer like this one a MUST for anyone who wants to grill or BBQ.  Not only has it dramatically improved my cooking skillz, it's also super convenient as you can bring the remote inside so you can keep an eye on your BBQ while you are watching TV or playing Uncharted 3 or whatever it is you do.There have been some complaints about reliability - it's very important not to submerge the probe when you wash it.  Just wipe the probe with a soapy spunge or rag or w/e you use, and make sure you don't get the wires wet where the wire meets the probe.  I haven't had any issues as I've been cleaning mine this way since I got it.  Meathead explains all of this in the articles I told you to read, hello.Setup/use is pretty easy.  You'll probably want to read the instructions but it's pretty intuitive.  Turn both units on and they sync.  Plug in the probes and make sure you push them all the way in.  The alarm features are a little more involved but are nice to have, particularly for say an overnight smoke.  I.e., you can set it up so if your grill temp dips below or rises above a certain point, an alarm will sound.  When the meat reaches it's target temp, an alarm will sound etc.  I don't use the alarms for day to day stuff, though, as it's pretty easy to keep an eye on the remote unit.Personally, I only use the food probe when I'm doing a roast or pork butt or turkey or something.  But, I use the probe for the grill temp virtually every time I use the grill or BBQ - the only eggception is if I'm searing something at high heat (or maybe pizzas or something where the temp might eggcede the limit for this baby).  Again, I really can't believe I wasn't using this before.If you're looking at this, buy it.  You need it, or something like it, but this seems like the best quality for the buck unless you want to get something more involved like a BBQ Guru (which is basically a thermostat).

I bought this set for Xmas for my nephew, Ben Franklin.  Ben doesn't eat a very healthy diet because his parents are morons and feed him a bunch of carby junk - all kinds of puffs and cereal crap like that, which is ok but not when that's ALL you ever eat, he doesn't even eat chicken fangers as far as I know.  I was hoping that maybe playing with this sammich set would teach him a little something about what normal people like to eat for lunch.I do not think this has improved his eating habbits, but he does enjoy playing with it.  Hopefully after a few more weeks this set will train him to make his uncle sandwiches when I come to visit.Also - the quality is very nice.  Good wood.  Good paint job.  I almost want to eat the tomato.  I wish someone would have bought me this when I was younger.

My landscaper recommended I get one of these as I have a tree that wasn't getting enough water via my regular irrigation system schedule.  I didn't even know these things eggzisted.This thing is incredibly easy to program and use - it doesn't even come with an instruction manual.  Even a moron could program this thing.  Gives a wide range of options as far as how often you want it to come on and for how long.  The manual option is also very useful - just push a button and it waters for a specified # of minutes.Time will tell on reliability - I've only had it about a week but it has worked flawlessly so far.  I will edit my review if anything ever goes wrong.  My only fear would be if it were to somehow die while the water was on, and not shut it off, fortunately I have a neighbor who watches my house like a hawk and I'm pretty sure she'd notice and turn it off.Note batteries weren't included so you may want to order 2 AAs too.  Also note it doesn't look eggzactly like the picture (different color, manual button says 'manual' instead of the pic of a hand), this isn't a big deal tho.

I shoot a lot and I have been using the very similar 3M Nitro corded ear plugs for awhile.  I used to buy them by the 100 pack and always had a bunch of pairs stuffed into my various range bags.  Those were evidently discontinued but these 3M EAR corded plugs are very similar, I was very happy to find them and bot two 100-packs I like them that much.I like this particular style for various reasons:1)  They are very comfortable - more comfortable than any of the non-disposable ear plugs I have tried.2)  They offer pretty good protection - particularly when paired with electronic muffs to "double up" hearing protection.  Overall comfort to protection ratio is pretty hard to beat.3)  They are disposable - makes them great for sharing, plus ear plugs get nasty after a few uses so I prefer to throw them out for a new pair anyway.  Yet they can still be worn multiple times.  My friend Blair, who's very cheap, hangs onto the same pair and always insists on reusing them even though I am the one paying, which is odd since he never seems to have any problem shooting up all my ammo without offering to pay.  After a range session, he likes to hold the two plugs together and wrap the cord around them, which apparently looks to him like a butt or cleavage or something, and it always gives him a good laugh nomatter how many times he's done it.  Then he shows it to everyone and says "he, he, look at that!  hehe".  But this little trick of his isn't purely for show, as he stores them this way for next time.4)  I like the cord because I am usually using these to double up under my electronic ear-pro muffs.  At a day at the range or a class I will periodically take the plugs out if I want to hear voices better w/ just the electronic ear pro, and I don't lose them because the cord is around my neck.  With non-corded, I always loose them.5)  Super portable and convenient - can always have a handful conveniently stuffed in a pocket or in a range bag etc.Cons - None.  I really don't think I can think of a single con.

I received this item from the vine program but it's no longer in my fridge.  That means, either a) I drank it and it was neither good nor bad enough to remember, or b) somebody thought it looked good enough to try it.  My friends are all big complainers in addition to major food mooches, so if it was b) and they didn't like it, then I'm sure I would have heard about it.Conclusion:  3 Stars, this is one of the rare cases where I don't think I can add much value one way or the other here.

I'm a bar snob.  The best out there are 18 rabbits.  Kind bars and Larabars are ok too, as are some Think! bars I got from the vine program.  These Kellog bars are not bad - not as good as those I listed, but in a world where there are some pretty terrible bars out there, they aren't half bad.Conclusion:  Worth trying, but not my favourite.

I had my gasket burn off my large BGE and replaced it with a nomex gasket applied with 3M Super 77 Adhesitive.IF you are an egghead and if your gasket burns off, it is worth replacing with Nomex IMO.  If you are an egghead and your OEM gasket doesn't burn off ... don't sweat it, it doesn't need to be replaced unless it gives you problems and not everyone has them (I think when they burn it's mostly due to flashbacks on high heat cooks).However, while the nomex gasket is a worthwhile upgrade, I'm just amazed people can get away selling them - uh, if you email the mothership, they will send you a free one.

This is the best store bought sweet style BBQ sauce I've ever had.  I use it primarily on baby backs.  It's hard to find locally, so I order it online and I always have a few jars in my pantry.  When I have people over for ribs, they rave about the sauce, and I'll usually end up giving a couple of jars away.  It's good on chicken too, though I mostly prefer these thick sweet style sauces for ribs.

Not just a book of recipes, but also goes into discussion of different types of doughs and cheeses and pros/cons when making a pizza (i.e., buffalo mozzerella is wet so needs to be accounted for).Overall a good flatbread book.  I have not specifically made any of the recipes here, but I have consulted it when making pizzas on my Big Green Egg.

I bought this primarily for smoking baby back ribs on my big green egg (using car wash mike's method, google it).It's well designed and works well - right shape and size to either use as a roaster, or to turn upside down and use for ribs.However, after only a handful of uses over a few months, the finish has worn off and it's rusted in places.  I will admit, like my grill grates etc. I don't always clean it off immediately after use (so has some grease on it) and I store it outside ... yes this is hard on things, but the product description mentions it can be used for BBQ (and many of us in warm climates store our grill gear outside).I still give it 3 stars because it's cheap, so I shouldn't expect a top notch long lasting finish.Bottom line - in my opinion, this would work fine for indoor roasting type stuff in the oven (i.e. turkey), although I would be sure to clean it soon after with mild detergent.  However, because of the finish I would not recommend this product if you're looking for something to use on your outdoor grill/BBQ/smoker.

My new weekly obsession did not disappoint this week! Every week Kandi Steiner releases a new episode in the Palm South University series, and Episode 4 is by far my favorite episode so far!The drama is getting bigger as the season goes on, and Episode 4 focuses on Jess, Cassie and Skylar. After what we found out in Episode 3 about Skylar and Adam, my heart broke for Cassie, but I was happy to see her not letting it bring her down completely. If anyone is at fault with that mess, it's definitely Adam! Jess is still avoiding Jarrett, and Jarrett is NOT a fan of her behavior, and things definitely get interesting between these two in this weeks installment.I loved seeing Bear and Skylar making up and Skylar opening up more about why she's in the poker tournaments. Skylar is an amazing character, I really enjoy reading her parts in this series. Cassie and her best friend Paris finally seem to realize that things aren't the same anymore, and I really want to punch her friend in the face. She's just a snob and I'm glad Cassie has the girls at her house to chill with since her "best friend" is obviously a stuck up brat!This week's episode definitely is fun and sexy. We get to see the girls prepping for the Halloween Party, and get some more background on these awesome characters. I can't wait till next Tuesday to read the next episode, and I think I may cry when this is all over! If you haven't picked these books up yet, what are you doing?! Pick up your copies and fall in love with the characters of Palm South University today!

What an absolutely amazing story! I was thrown into Indi and Carter's world, and I loved every single second of it.We meet Carter as he's about to move in with his mom and step-father. He only has a few months till he's 18 and can leave. He adores his mother, but can NOT stand the man she has married. When Carter was 5 the carefree child that he was, was changed forever by some hurtful words from his grandfather. That name, that tone, shaped him into who he is now. He's cocky, he's arrogant, he doesn't really give a crap, and he really is a Bastard at times. When his new neighbor Indiana (aka Indi, "Kid") enters his life, he's drawn to her, but knows she deserves so much better than what he thinks of himself.Carter and Indi as teenagers were quite frustrating at times. You could tell immediately that there was chemistry between them, but Indi is too good, and Carter is too Carter, so they are at odds a lot. When they aren't at eachother's throats though, their friendship and banter is awesome. I enjoyed getting to see Carter open up to Indi, something he's never done before. It showed, even though he didn't want to admit it, how much he really did care for Indi. Having Indi, and her dad Ross, in his life really showed him that there are people out there that do care for him and are good people. I just wish in the end of part one, he wouldn't have done what he did. I understand why Carter did what he did in this part of the book, but at the same time, I was heartbroken for all characters involved.When we move into part two and get to see how things are going five years later, it's one crazy ride. Carter has grown a lot in the five years he's been gone and really made something out of his life, but the one thing missing, is the girl he left all those years ago. When he has to come back to Sydney for his mom, he wasn't expecting things to be so crazy with him and Indi. I knew Indi wouldn't be happy at first to see him, but I wasn't expecting her reaction, it was kind of hilarious and he did get what he deserved.These two have a hard time finding their way back to one another, and when they do, things get difficult for them yet again. I was scared about how Carter would handle some of the things that happened, but to see how amazingly he handled everything, really showed how much his character has grown throughout this book. Indi... her character is pretty amazing, but man, this girl is stubborn! Her and Carter are definitely butting heads a lot in this book, and it's quite entertaining.To say this book was not what I was expecting would be an understatement. I was expecting a cocky arrogant man throughout the entire story, but instead I got an amazing and beautifully written love story. I was not able to put this book down, and I really enjoyed the characters in this book. The ending of this book was perfect and I was left with a happy feeling in my heart after seeing how everything ended up for these amazing characters!

Looking for a hot and sexy story? Taking Flight is definitely one to pick up. I was intrigued by this book based off the synopsis, and then when I dived into it, I was unable to put it down. Told in the male POV this is a definite twist on the other love stories out there today.We meet Kane, who's a pilot and kind, maybe.. well yeah he's addicted to sex. He doesn't care where he gets it or who he gets it from. Scorned for a relationship gone bad he has no intentions of getting back into another relationship. At first I wasn't a big fan of Kane's. He came off arrogant, cocky, and kind of a douche, but as I got into this story, I found myself falling in love with him. He really is a unique character and I loved his story.When Mya enters Kane's life, it was unexpected and the feelings she makes him feel are unwelcome at first. I loved how he didn't want to see her, but did everything he could on the chance that he would run into her. When they finally bump into one another again, the chemistry is undeniable, and I loved watching both of them take a chance on one another. We get to see everything that Kane has been through with his ex Maddy and his best friend Dean, but with Mya he is able to finally start moving on. These two definitely figured out their own lives while they were together, and I think this made their love for one another so much stronger.I really enjoyed Mya's character. I think it was awesome that we didn't get to see what was going on in her head, and there were times I would have loved to, especially towards the end. She's a strong character, and she brings something to this book and to Kane that really brings this story full circle.Mya and Kane's relationship definitely is not easy, it seems as soon as things seem to be going great, something happens and sets them back a few steps. There are parts in this book that are heartbreaking, where your soul is crushed for Kane and for the other characters, but Mya was there to pick up the pieces and help heal all the wounds that are ripped open in this book for Kane.I loved the writing of this book, and how much the characters grew from the beginning of this story to the end. This is a beautifully written book with a hot and steamy love story. Once I picked this one up, I wasn't able to put it down. I highly recommend Taking Flight! Trust me, the ending/epilogue... AMAZING! Go one-click your copy of this hot read today!

What an absolutely amazing and stunning story. From the first words till the epilogue I was drawn into Summer and Cole's story.What happens when hot, celebrity, movie star Cole Masten and southern country girl Summer Jenkins get thrown into eachothers' lives? A whole lot of chemistry, hotness, anger, hate, arguments, and sexual tension, that's what!It's really hard to put into words how amazing this book is. Alessandra Torre did an amazing job with these characters and making you feel what they were feeling and going through. I enjoyed the mystery of what happened three years ago to make Summer the outcast of Quincey, and seeing her fight tooth and nail against her attraction to Cole. Seeing Cole go through what he did with his ex, and then be thrown into the whirlwind of a change from L.A. to the quiet southern town of Quincey was amazing. He was no longer the pampered movie star, no one really cared who he was, and he had to do things by himself. Granted, at times I thought he was a bit arrogant with how he handled things, but as time went on, I grew to love the person Cole had become.Summer and Cole do not get off to a great start. A knee to the nuts, her blowing him off as if he's a no one, him being a jerk, it was the setup of a lifetime for their story. Once they seem to get along, something always happens that makes them go off one one another. Sometimes its a war of words, other times a war of silence and ignoring. No matter how much they argued, you could tell they were going to give into all the sexual tension in the air and it would be amazing. The first time, it was hot... but the night that changed everything for them, it was absolutely beautiful. I love these two together and I wanted them together as soon as they started calling each other on all their crap.I must say, the supporting characters in this book really helped bring this story full circle. Brad, and his intimidating lawyerish ways, and keeping Cole on a tight leash was awesome. His rules really put a hamper on Cole's plans, but in the end, ended up saving him. Ben, the location scout, and new best friend to Summer. This guy is hilarious and really helped bring Summer out of her life of solitude she'd been living in. Justin, we didn't get to see much of him, but he was a good friend to Cole and his reaction to seeing Cole being "good" was awesome. Mama, Summer's mom, was a great shoulder for Summer to lean on, and did everything she could to see Summer happy, when she was younger, and now as an adult. Then there is the infamous, "Cocky" this character.. well you'll just have to read the book to find out more about him, and why I just loved him and Cole with him. Priceless is all I am going to say about it!This book definitely plays out like a movie, which is kind of ironic since it's about a movie, and I felt as if this was playing out in front of me while I read it. I adored Cole and Summer's love/hate like/tolerate relationship and the road their relationship took us on. Not only is this book about Cole and Summer and their road to possible happiness, but it's also a lot about these two moving on from the past and learning who they really are. The drama and sexual tension in this book definitely was done beautifully. I highly recommend this book, no cliffhangers, no ridiculous story line, just a beautiful written story. Five + stars to Hollywood Dirt!

What an absolutely amazing and beautiful second chance romance! Words cannot express how much I truly loved this book and Mia and Jensen!Mia and Jensen were meant to be, fell in love young, and had the world at the palm of their hands, until Jensen made one major mistake and the two of them were separated for five years. Mia hates Jensen, yet no man can ever live up to who he is and she's not sure she can ever love someone the way she loved him, yet she's not sure she can even speak to him without being hurt. When Mia takes a temporary job in New York City, she knows there is a chance of running into Jensen, but she wasn't expecting him to be working on the same project as her. Jensen pursue's Mia relentlessly and you can really tell how much he still loves her, if only he can make her see.I really wanted to hate Jensen's character, but he made it so freaking hard. I loved him. His "Jensen Talks" articles we got to see and how he spoke of Mia to the world was truly beautiful. He knows he made a mistake, but never has he forgotten how much he loves Mia. Seeing him try to get her to open up and be his again was awesome and I wanted to strangle Mia for not jumping right back into his arms Granted, I understand why Mia was so hesitant, her heart was crushed last time they were together, and she can not go through that again.Their relationship definitely isn't easy, but once Mia starts talking to Jensen, you see that happiness begin to shine through. Her friends are hilarious in trying to get her to see that she will fall back in love with him, and then when she does, they are even more funny with their "I told you so's" and their "what are you going to do's?".The character that definitely stole this story though was Olivia. I loved this little girl and she was perfect, you couldn't help but fall in love with this sweet little girl. Mia obviously felt the same way, and she has a harder time saying goodbye to her than I thought she would.If you're looking for an angsty second chance romance book that has a little bit of everything, laughs, drama, tears, this is definitely the book to pick up. I devoured this book in one sitting and am eagerly awaiting more books by Claire Conreras as I am in love with her writing style! This book read like a movie playing in front of you, and the characters are beautifully written!

What an absolutely amazing story! I loved Brody and Jordan's story and all the angst that this story brought!Jordan Elliot has won the prestigious college sports scholarship and is spending her senior year playing soccer in college away from her home in Australia.  Her goals are to play the best she can, finish school, and make it big in her career. She never expected Brody Madden to enter her life and turn it upside down. Brody is the college football star who is expected to go pro, but he's having a problem passing his classes. Enter Jordan as his new tutor and things definitely get interesting.Brody was attracted to Jordan the first time he saw her, he had no clue she was going to be the one helping him in his Ethic's class, and when he finds out, he's shocked and pleased. Problem is, Brody doesn't want any help, he has a horrible way of seeing himself and sets himself up for failure a lot in this book.Jordan and Brody's relationship is full of drama and angst! When things are good with them, they are amazing, but when they are bad... it's really, really bad. I was rooting for these two throughout this entire story, but at times I really didn't think things would work out for them. Too many things stood in their way, too many things were hidden, and both of them are at the tops of their careers.  I truly loved these two together, I just wish at times their relationship would have been a little easier.I loved how strong Jordan was in this book. She was confident in her career, and she believed in Brody when no one did, not even himself. She fought for him, when he wouldn't fight for himself, and she truly loved him. Even when things go wrong with them she still believed in him and fought for him, and I loved this about her. She didn't lose herself in Brody, but found herself, and she was stronger with him by her side than she was without him.Brody, this poor, poor man. On the outside it looks like he has it all, but he really and truly doesn't. He comes from a messed up family who doesn't know what love is, he's struggling in school, and has never really had anyone in his corner. Jordan really helps bring Brody up, but there is only so much she can do and he needs to help himself. Brody does some things in this book that will make you want to scream, I know I did a few times. He works on forgetting and ignoring things instead of making himself better. When he does some of the things he does, I wanted to hate him, but at the same time, I hurt for him and everything he has been through.The supporting characters in this book are absolutely amazing. I loved Jax (aka "bananaman"), Eddie, Hayden, and Leah. Leah is a fierce friend and is super protective Jordan. Jax is Brody's cousin, roommate and best friend. He is there for Jax as much as he can be, and even though things at first didn't go how Jax wanted, he's very protective of both Jordan and Brody and is the glue that keeps them together at times.Even though this book is full of drama and angst, the love story in this book is truly magnificent! If you're expecting a happy go lucky, sports romance, The End Game, is not that book. This book is edgy, angst filled, and one that will definitely pull at your heartstrings! Be prepared for one emotional roller coaster when reading this book, but it is one that definitely needs to be read!

Another great installment in the Palm South University series! In this week's episode the drama is turned up a notch and some stupid mistakes are made.In Episode Three we get more of Ashleigh,  Erin, and Adam. We finally find out what Ashleigh has been doing when not at the house and missing sorority events. At first I was like YOU GO GIRL! but then... she does something horrible and I wanted to strangle her. I hope she figures out what she did, and fixes it soon, as I really like her character and don't want her to go down the road she is on right now.Erin... Erin is pretty amazing, and we get more of a background on her as well. Seeing her speaking to her mother made my heart break for her. She doesn't have the support she should have in family, and that explains why she's so close to all of her sisters and throws herself into everything she does. I really enjoyed getting into her head a bit in this episode.Adam... I wanted to like Adam, but him and Skylar need to be kicked, slapped, or whatever else will hurt them. Skylar is definitely in the wrong with what she did, but Adam, he knew what he did and that makes it even worse. Trust me, you will want to junk punch both of these characters by the time you finish this episode, and that sucks, because I really do like Skylar!This season of Palm South University is amazing and I can't wait till each Tuesday to get the next episode. This episode was definitely the most scandalous so far and I can't wait to see what happens next week!

What an absolutely amazing story! The Drafter is not in my normal genre of reading, but is definitely one of my favorite reads of 2015!The Drafter focuses on Peri Reed and Opti agent who can bend time. If you've read Sideswiped (the prequel to Drafter) then you've met Peri before. This book takes place in 2030 in the new Detroit. Things are quite different in the future, and Peri and her anchor Jack have a rough go at their last assignment. When they get back to headquarters, things definitely go wrong for Peri and Jack, and it opens us up to this absolutely amazing story.This book is a definite mix of suspense and sci-fi, to make a story that I was unable to put down. Peri's character is unique, and I adored her character. She's been through so much, and she doesn't remember most of it. How would it feel to not know who in your life you can trust? That's how Peri feels throughout most of this book. Between forgetting major things in her life, and everyone trying to manipulate her, her life gets pretty crazy and dangerous. Throughout this book, Peri realizes what she has done and who she really is, and isn't at ease with any of it. She's made some bad choices, and since she has no memory, only bits and pieces, she doesn't know if she did things because she wanted to, or because she was trying to help others.With the Alliance trying to get Peri, and Silas trying to figure out what is right and what is wrong, the suspense of this book is amazing. I was on pins and needles throughout this book trying to figure out who was bad, who was good, and who Peri really was. I did fall in love with Silas all over again (we met him in Sideswiped). His character really is a strong one in this book, and helps balance out a lot of the craziness. You can tell how hard it is for him to see what is going on with Peri, and him trying to help her.There is a lot in this book that is awesome, but can't be written about for fear of spoiling this story for you. I will tell you that I loved Taf, Howard, and Silas. These three are awesome, and I hope we will get more of them, especially crazy Taf, in future installments of this series. Each main character in this book brought something to the table and weren't there for fluff. I am not a fan of Fran's or Bill's. I don't think either of them are good and one is not better than the other. Allen.... what can I say? I'm not sure how I feel about Allen. I hated him, I liked him, I definitely didn't trust him, but when this book ended, I was left with a feeling of contentment with his character. I'm not sure if I trust him yet, but I look forward to seeing how his story plays out as well.Even though this book does have a defined ending, there is so many more questions left unanswered that will leave me waiting anxiously for the next book in the Peri Reed Chronicles. There is a bit of romance in this book, but it is not what makes this story. Peri and all her craziness, and figuring out the truth is what makes this story stand out above a lot of other books I've read this year. I am in love with this series and can't wait for more!I have received this book as a member of the XOXperts, XOXO After Darks official street team, in exchange for an honest review.

Torn Hearts is the beginning of Mia and Jensen's story. In Kaleidescope Hearts we met Mia and Jensen, and found out they had some sort of history. In this novella, we get why there is so much animosity between Mia and Jenson, and I loved every single second of it!This prequel gives us the history of Mia and Jensen and what went wrong with them. I enjoyed how much Jensen really seemed to love Mia, but then he took her heart and crushed it. I am proud of Mia for not dwelling on it, and just cutting him out of her life. Granted they belong together, but Jensen made a decision that altered their lives forever, and didn't think about Mia in the decision making.Torn Hearts takes place in the past, and brings us right up to the future. After seeing how these two were together and how they are now, I am definitely looking forward to their full length novel! I am one-clicking it immediately!

Enrapture by Rachel Van DykenIf you are an Eagle Elite fan and can't wait for the next book, reading Enrapture in this book is worth it! Enrapture is told mostly in Joyce's (Trace's grandmother's) point of view, but we get to see inside of Nixon and Trace's head as well. We finally get the back story of Joyce, Frank, and Luca and learn more about the twins we were told about in Endure.My heart broke for Joyce, Luca and Frank in this book. They all made tough decisions, and learned to live with them. But the love Joyce and Frank had was different than the all encompassing love we found that she had with Luca. Seeing how their story really plays into the Trace, Nixon, Chase story from previous books is interesting as well.This is a definite must read and a reason to purchase Hurt. The Eagle Elite series is my favorite series EVER and getting any glimpses into the craziness that is part of these books is always a plus. I wanted to cry with Trace, and I was furious with Frank for how he let the information for Trace to find when he wasn't around.
