We have modified a few things (how we approach the calendar for example) just to keep things fresh as it is very similar to Saxon Math K and we did that all last year.The workbook itself has great content. Most days it has one side with the day's work and on the other side has the homework. I like this as it helps reinforce the work you did in the morning later that day. It also includes the assessments. We do them because they can be enlightening for the parent. Not to give a grade to your child. Rather, to understand what areas the child needs to review or what he did not understand.The pages of the workbook are thin. My son has made holes in a couple of pages trying to erase. Now I ask him to call me when he needs to erase something. I wish the paper was of better quality. One good thing about this workbook is that you can easily remove the pages using the perforated top and it comes with three holes to place the pages in a binder if you wish. The workbook opens from the top. This is great for left handed children.

I received this product free for evaluation.While I've been growing my own herbs each spring for over 10 years, I am a relatively new gardener to more labor intensive plants because until recently, I lived in places with no backyard. I've had rose bushes, tomatoes and peppers for two years. During this time, I've used regular scissors and kitchen scissors to remove dead roses from the bushes and other assorted pruning.This method works but it can tire your hand. Then I got these pruners. I didn't realize how nice it is for the pruning tool to be opened and all you have to do is squeeze! This is so much more comfortable! These have a little locking mechanism that is very easy to use. A little yellow cube located between the handles holds them together. You slide it down with your thumb and the pruners open. This does not require a whole lot of effort, which is very nice. I would say these are meant for small jobs only (nothing thick), as they are relatively small. I am left handed.No trouble! Big plus, as us lefties know to use our right hand to cut as a general rule.The grip is nice and non slip. Unlike scissors, these do not enclose your fingers. My husband cannot use the scissors I usually use for pruning because one time he did and he ended up with blisters all over his knuckles. These work for people with thin or thick fingers equally well.They have a good weight to them, enough that they feel substantial, but not so much that your hand would tire immediately. The package is an easy open package. I appreciate this as I detest having to wrestle with a package that contains a sharp edge.I have not yet used them long enough to comment on long term durability. I am constantly reviewing on Amazon, and if I find something particularly fantastic or terrible, I will update. As of now, I would recommend them.

I got this shirt because the text is hilarious. That part does not disappoint. The shirt is of good quality, the material is nice, the print out on the t-shirt is clear.My issue is that this is marketed as a women's t-shirt but it is rather wide on the waist and a bit snug on the arms. The fit is a bit disappointing and closer to a normal men's shirt.

I received this bottle for a large discounted price in exchange of an honest review. This is the first time I use an infuser bottle.This is a very good quality bottle. The plastic is hard and sturdy. The filter is also made of a hard plastic. It all comes apart, so it is easy to clean. The fruit stays at the bottom. The holes on the filter are relatively large, so small pieces of fruit can come out of the filter. This does not bother me, but it may bother children.You can use the bottle with or without the filter. When locked (there's a picture of a lock on the side of the bottle for locking/unlocking the bottle cap), the cap does not open. It is large and slim enough to fit in a standard cup holder. It is nice the opening is covered in case the bottle falls on the ground.I think this bottle is best for us to make infused water at home and pour in glasses. It pours very well.Why did I give it 3 stars?First, my glove size is between a small and a medium. I am female. It was difficult for me to slide the strap over my hand and ditto for removing it. That said, the strap is also very sturdy and if your hand is slim you should have no trouble. This should be no trouble if the bottle will be hanging from a stroller or on a cup holder. The cup is fairly large, so it is a little heavy to carry on a wrist strap for a long time.So, say you are walking with your water bottle. You and your kids are thirsty and you forget to slide the thingy on the cap to unlock. Or your hands are sweaty. This lock/unlock mechanism is very annoying.I prefer the convenience to take a quick sip and I keep it unlocked. It does not leak when he cap is on anyway. It does spring open when pressing the release button.You have to make sure to drink with the cap on the side. My nose bumps the cap if I drink with the cap perpendicular to my nose. I find that annoying. I do not like the design on the side of the bottle.Also, it does not keep liquids cold at all. Again, best for infusing at home.Overall, I think this bottle is a fine bottle.

I am currently half-way through using the manual for the level A-1 with my son. I am a homeschooler and I much prefer my manuals to be all inclusive and for them to tell me exactly what to do and say each day. This is that kind of manual. The format is similar to Saxon Math in that it tells the parent what to say, how to correct the student, and it is very thorough. The only thing I had to make so far is little squares with letters so my son can make words when the program calls for spelling games.The daily lessons are not very long, which is perfect for a young child. We are using it even though my son can already read Bob books and simple readers, but he is starting to write this year. Last year we used the Ordinary Parent Guide to Teaching Reading, which is why my son can read a little. But that other program, is very boring and does not include writing. This one is tying it all together and it is not overwhelming at all.This book (together with the workbook, which should be used together) is fantastic and I highly recommend it.

I'm giving this product 2 stars because the pants are comfortable, do not smell and are inexpensive. Also, they have a cute cut and fit as expected. I wear jeans size 14-16 and I bought the XL and it fits fine. I am 5'3" and they are a little long, but not overly so. These would be too short for someone taller than maybe 5'6". They offer a hipster young kind of look for lounging or sleeping. It even has two pockets and a string to adjust at the hip. I just wished they were made better and with better material. If the quality was better, these would be easily a 5 star pant.All I've done is try them on and the seam on the side of the pant ALREADY ripped a little. I'm like, what? Horrible seams on the inside. Just a single row of stitches. I took a picture of the busted seam - look it still has the tag ON.Also these pants are made of a thin material. It is soft to the touch, yes. But it is thin. Anyone nowadays knows that these thin materials never last and break/fade very easily.

This book is short and easy to read. I am pleased with the content because while I am writing this review at the end of September it is 100F outside on a Sunday and I was looking for a couple of ideas of things to do with my kids that do not require a TV. Of course, I can use google and Pinterest. This book is nice in a way, because it has the instructions on how to do the activities and it is already divided by categories. Pinterest doesn't always link to instructions and Google sometimes gives you so many results that I end up in the computer or my phone way too long going through information...Anyway, it has several lists of educational activities to do with toddlers to learn basics like letters, numbers, colors and shapes. Some of these activities require a lot of preparation but I have all the tools required already (I mean who has toddlers and doesn't have construction paper?).I found a couple of typos in the book. Nothing outrageous (hold instead of hole - for example). It is generally well written and easy to read. I would recommend for 100F days, rainy days or snow days.

I suffer from GERD and as a result my stomach and digestion can be a little delicate at times. For this reason, I'm usually skeptical about supplements as due to my reflux if there's anything in them that is a little foul and can cause me stomach trouble I will know. This drink has done no such thing! My stomach has remained undisturbed while drinking this.I mix the drink with a spoon in about 8oz of water. I suppose you could add more water, but in my opinion that would be too diluted. While the powder dissolves enough simply using a spoon, it stays a little grainy while drinking it. I found this is not a drink to linger over as the powder will eventually precipitate to the bottom and form an unpleasant looking sludge. It is best to keep the spoon in the glass and mix a little before drinking. Be ready to finish it all relatively quickly. The taste is truly pleasant and it is a natural tasting berry.As far as I can tell, the ingredients are all natural. I'm thinking of this drink as a raw multivitamin. A small peeve is that FOS (fructooligosaccharide) is labeled as a probiotic. I believe it should be labeled as a prebiotic, as probiotics are actual bacteria. It does contain Lactobacillus, but I do not believe they are live cultures.Overall, I recommend this formula for people interested in ingesting ground up fruits, Cyanobacteria and vegetables in a powder form. I cannot comment on energy or skin changes. You would need a controlled trial for that. But I can say, this drink does not bother my stomach, it tastes good for a green drink and if the label is correct, this is full of good things for your body.I received this product at a big discount on a coupon club online to test it and provide my opinion and review.

While I have read about using a holistic approach to teaching preschoolers elsewhere, this short book lists strategies for teaching groups that can easily be applied at home. The author tells us why and/or how these strategies help make the child a better reader.A couple of years ago, when I started teaching my son to read I started with letter sounds, which is the obvious thing to do. Of course, I read to my child and we did many of the activities mentioned in this book. But it wasn't clear to me how playing with play dough, following instructions, understanding left and right and other life skills come together to help learn reading and comprehension. This books explains, superficially but with enough detail, that as a parent you can be more cognizant of why you are engaging your child in making a collage. Or perhaps, the other area I can improve on: asking the kids more questions before and after the story.This book is easy to read, well edited and well thought out. Appears aimed at teachers, but I'm sure many parents of young children will find this book very useful.Why I gave it 4 stars and not 5**This book is very short. For the category of short books this is an excellent read. There are plenty of places in this book where the authors can add information, activities, web links and so on. While the book is very good, any buyer must beware that it is short. It is well written, and as such it leaves me wanting a bit more content.

We've had two Skip Hop lunch boxes for two years and we use them once or twice weekly. We have the monkey (still has the banana zipper puller thing, and the ladybug).After a few months of use for the ladybug lunch box, the flower detail fell off the zipper. This little detail is how you pull the zipper so it was a major bummer. I solved the problem of how I would pull the zipper by putting in a key chain ring. That ring has been in place for over a year with no issues. Its not cute, but it is functional. Not removing a star because I like them and the monkey lunch box is still fine.I like that the lunch box has a little mesh pocket. I use it to contain ice packs, napkins or cutlery. It keeps items fresh and cold for about 4 hours in the heat with two ice packs. After that time frame, I'm not sure I'd trust it unless items are still cold.This lunch box is the right size for a small kid lunch for preschool. You will need the right containers though. It is a relatively small lunchbox, with a rounded top so it is sometimes hard to fit larger containers.When my daughter was attending a Mother's Day out program, I had no trouble fitting her lunch. We are homeschooling now and mostly use it to take snacks for me and 2 kids when we go out. We used to use both: one for items that need refrigeration and one for items that do not like crackers. It worked well for us until recently, as my son is now 5 and eats an actual regular amount of food. For this reason, I've started to use a larger lunch box if we will be out of the house for a while. But it's fine for toddlers and mom.

If you are wondering if these crackers taste like boxed animal crackers, let me tell you that no. In no way do these crackers taste like the traditional $1 version animal crackers.These remind me of the flavor of those cookies they serve on Delta flights. Or Trader Joe's cookie butter. These are almost flaky, crumbly and deliciously addictive crackers. We used them for a Kinder school assignment where we grouped the animals by habitats (camel for desert, lion for grasslands...). It made the project scrumptious.Highly recommend. If I have any qualms is that they are crumbly and many crackers were broken upon arrival. But they are so seriously yummy, that we don't care.

This backpack is exactly the right size for a small child. I got this for my son when he was two and was going to a little day care/preschool. It looked a little big on him at the time, but he could carry it on his back and it could fit all he needed: his lunch box, water bottle and change of clothes.At age 3 and 4 this backpack was the right size for him. It is very comfortable to carry with the padded straps and easy to clean with a damp towel and soap.The zipper is good quality as it is still fine after 3 years. Now that he is 5 he has a big boy backpack, but my daughter who is 3 can use it. It still looks great. It is a great buy.

I used these with two babies. Mostly as backup, as I found that I preferred using the all in one cloth diapers better. These are worth having around with pre-folds.I found I used these when the others were still in the wash, as extras in the diaper bag or in between short periods of time between a change and bath time. That sort of thing.The covers themselves are great. I never had leakage or a blowout with these. But again, these were not my everyday diapers. It wasn't because of the cover, it was because the prefold diapers I used with these covers stay wet and the constant wetness irritated by babies skin. I did change them often, but little babies sometimes will wet the diaper a little shortly after changing and I wouldn't necessarily notice, then I would find irritated skin. So, I used the all in ones more often.They covers are easy to wash and air dry. I also used the dryer on low and never had any problems.It is a matter of what works for you really. I would still recommend getting a couple at first to decide if you want to use these full time or not.

Ah! The cleanup episode! This is one of my favorites as of course all parents of small children need to deal with constant huge messes. This episode is a really good way to help us parents start the conversation with our kids in a calm manner.The other excellent episode in this season is the "time to go" episode. Because really, who hasn't dealt with the child that does not want to leave the play ground (or play date...)? Again, a great way to start a conversation and provide coping mechanism for situations that can be a big deal for little children. Giving them and the adults, tools for behavior.I'm a big fan of Daniel Tiger for the preschool age crowd. Highly recommend all the episodes. The two above are just the ones I find myself playing for my children often.

As a parent I have sometimes wondered how to handle the sharing issue that so often happens at play dates and playgrounds. After all, not parents want to approach it the same way as there is no consensus on the matter.We watched the sharing episode of Daniel Tiger. This episode provides a case study for small children on how to cope with this issue. And it has ideas for the parents as well.This show is not just about sharing! It covers other situations, including having a babysitter for example.In fact, we had a babysitter come over for the first time a couple of weeks ago. We watched the babysitter episode, and reassured the kids that we would come back and they would have fun.I recommend this show highly for anyone with preschool age children.

What a great season this is. It helps the kids with coping mechanisms to use during social situations. In this season they talk about jealousy for example. These are good for the parents to watch as well, as we can reinforce the positive message and give the children a way to react and a character they can relate with.I highly recommend this show for anyone with small children 5 and under. Like I said, it is best to watch with the kids to help with the curriculum and understanding of the situations.

This show is aimed to pre-schoolers and younger. The first episode of this season helped me potty train my 3 yr old daughter. We watched it many times and sang their potty song over and over. The curriculum is good for the parents too as it features excellent ideas on how to deal with life situations with little children. Including having the kids understand that there are bathrooms everywhere.My second favorite Daniel Tiger episode is also in this season and it's the vegetable tester episode. It's just a great help for mommy when the kids become interested in tasting new healthy foods just watching a tv show.Highly recommend.

This show is fantastic overall. It is aimed to pre-schoolers and young kindergarten age children. The curriculum is good for the parents too as it features excellent ideas on how to deal with life situations with little children.In this season they include how Daniel deals with a new baby. This is excellent as it is common for 2 to 4 year olds to have a new baby sibling.Highly recommend.

My husband (then fianc) and I listened to Rich Dad Poor Dad by Kiosaki in 2006 on a long car trip shortly before our wedding (this is how I remember the year we listened to it). After that we bought the Cashflow game and we've played it once or twice a year ever since.This book is an excellent refresher of the main points of the book. The writing is easy to read and follow. It does a great job of concisely summarizing the book by chapter.What it does not do is convey the urgency and motivation of the original. It made me remember that feeling though. Motivation is not the goal of this book. It's goal, which it does excellently, is to let you know the main take away of the original.Very well done.

With the word rose in the name I was expecting an old fashion rose smell. The fragrance is very faint and more soapy than flowery. Personally I didn't care for the smell of the soap, but I didn't dislike it. In any case, the fragrance does not linger at all.The feel of the soap is very clean. It lathers well. I use two pumps of soap to feel like I worked a good lather all over my face, but you can probably use only one pump.My face feels squeaky clean and soft. However, it does feel like the first step of a cleansing routine where you need to at the very least apply moisturizer after washing your face. At first I did not moisturize and some parts of my face were a little tight. I'm oily on the T-zone and that area was fine. This is probably best suited for oily skin and people who always use moisturizer after cleansing.I bought this at a discount to provide my review.

The content of this book is straight forward and no-nonsense. The book is short but full of ideas on how to approach weight loss and muscle mass increases. It feels like picking the brain of a personal trainer, which ultimately that is what the book intends. It is not a biochemical thesis or an elaborate diet with products to buy. I think it is useful, needed and great for the person who wants the information but doesn't have a lot of time to read a long elaborate book.The reason I gave the book 4 stars and not 5 is that this book needs a professional editor. Someone who will correct typos, grammatical mistakes and the like. Some readers will find the mistakes difficult and will not be able to enjoy the content of the book. I imagined the trainer had a charming accent and it didn't bother me. Just be aware.

My daughter adores her duplo. I got her this set for the 2013 Christmas when she was almost two. She played with it a little then. But now that she is 3 and a half she is really using for pretend play. I am writing this review as my child is playing with this set. This is durable and well made as you would expect from Lego.I am so glad Lego is making sets for girls. My daughter makes houses, gardens and uses the Lego princesses to pretend. She sometimes uses the white horse when she plays with my little pony.I am very pleased.

This little sweater fits my daughter, who wears 3T but can fit in some 4T clothes, very well if slightly large which is what I was going for. The size on the sweater is 4 not 4T which I think means it is slightly larger than a 4T.The sweater is well made and true to the color shown here. It is made in Philipines and has a Disney copyright symbol on the label. The ruffle detail on the cuffs and the hips makes it very feminine. It looks very pretty on.Note of caution about picky dressers. My daughter is 3 and loves pink which is why I bought this sweater in pink. But she is slightly confused as she feels like Sofia's merchandise should be purple. She'll wear it eventually.I washed and dried it with all my laundry on the normal cycles and had no trouble. I see a few loose threads here and there that look like extras and need to be trimmed. All the finishes are well done as far as I can tell.

It works well to keep the hot sun rays out of the car. It offers full window coverage for our basic Honda. Prior to this shade we had a terrible one from the dollar tree that did not cover the whole windshield and broke in days. This one is made of a paper like material that feels like it has a coating of some sort. It pops open so it is easy to place in the windshield. It's white with some writing (I wish it was just plain white). That's another good thing as I find the reflective shades that look like aluminum foil annoying when you walk past them.The material feels like if you punch it you will easily break it, but with some gentle handling it should be fine. The shade is a bit clunky to fold and slide back into the pouch it came with.The material is of questionable durability. Again, it should last if you take care of it and don't keep it near sharp objects.When we first opened this product I was appalled at the terrible chemical smell emanating from it. I immediately made my husband (who didn't think the smell was that bad) put this outside to air out. I thought we wouldn't be able to use it since the car would simply smell horrible.After a night spent outside airing out (we live in Southern California - no worries it would get wet), I'm happy to report it had no odor.We received this product at a discount in exchange for a review.

Arrived in good condition as expected. I cooked it as specified in the box and turned out fluffy, well seasoned and delicious.I served it with steamed fish and cherry tomatoes. Dinner was ready in about 15 minutes. I highly recommend.

For the price this is a 5 star conditioner! I have color treated hair. I wouldn't call my hair dry, but because it is long, color treated and I only trim the ends once or twice a year (I will have to adjust and do this more often) my ends tend to look frizzy and unattractive.This conditioner works better than the Natural instincts I was using prior to this one. My hair is looking shiny and very nice after using a hot straightening iron.I've used better conditioners, of course, but not for under $3.Highly recommend.

This is an ok toy for a child that is around 2 years old. By the time most boys are 5 they would be more interested in a remote control monster truck or car - something that could go over dirt or ride fast.We got this for our son when he was 3 for Christmas so we've had it for two years. Needless to say this toy is on its way to the trash pile as I don't think it would be worthwhile to donate it. It doesn't really work properly anymore - although the car itself (body) is not broken and looks fine. It works when it's new, and it was fun for my son at the time. I found it very irritating that you must make sure to turn it off. Otherwise you will all of a sudden hear a random noise - you go looking for it and eventually you'll see this car randomly moving or just making noises. But for the price I thought it was fine.My daughter got a remote control car from my little pony this past Christmas that works much better than this and my son was incredibly frustrated as the police car could not keep up. After that this toy has not been played with.I gave it 3 stars because when this car is new and the child is young enough, it is cute and fun.

Well, this was a fun read! It was a short easy read and free. This ebook was very well written. The ideas these ladies share are really good for any couple. I am a stay at home mom and my husband and I have been married for almost 10 years. These ideas are excellent and we are surely going to do at least two. I appreciate the fact that you offer suggestions on how to do the dates on a budget. Well done.I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 for two reasons. One is that while the book itself is solid, it is an advertisement for another book. It isn't clear if the content on that newer book includes this shorter ebook or not. I actually wouldn't mind reading the advertised book if there are new date ideas in it :) so in a way, the advertising is working. But for some reason it bothers me a little. Like I downloaded a teaser or a commercial instead of a stand alone book. I suppose you don't get that too much anymore as everything has advertising.Second, the authors are Christian. And I am not trying to say that is a bad thing at all! It is evident from the description that this is their world view so you know, don't read it if Christian references will be irritating to you. The book has a few biblical references and typical evangelical phrases about blessing each other and such. This is fine, but if they were to remove all those references they could bless a larger audience and reach beyond the Christian consumer. Again, the content and ideas are great and it would work for people of all religions or non-belief so it's a shame to limit the audience when your message is more universal. And I know people who could benefit from a book like this who would not read it due to Christian language.

We've had this TV for about a year and we are happy with it. Our comparison was our former TV which had been a hand-me down as my husband and I see the TV not as an essential appliance, but rather a nice to have item.My main complaint is that the volume controls are not great. Sometimes we have to increase the volume to the max setting, but it doesn't seem to really be any louder. The sound from DVDs played from the play station is rather terrible. But that is really the worst of it.It has a clear enough video output. It is pretty enough and easy controls to find and use. Love the Roku connectivity.

Crispy, delicious, kid friendly, individual portions, no stale goldfish bags...I usually get the regular size bag of goldfish and pack a portion using ziplock snack bags to take as snacks for the kids.The reason I got this box was to use the goldfish bags as a snack for my kid's soccer team. It's better to offer something that has not being touched by anyone: it's overall easier and more sanitary.And so, last night I distributed these bags amongst a group of 3 year olds. All of them eagerly grabbed a bag of goldfish and all were happily eating after the game with zero complaints. Right there is why I have these 5 stars Note of caution: if you are planning to keep a box like this as long term storage perhaps buy it at a store where you can check the expiration date. The box I receive has an expiration date of November 2015 - which is fine as we will use them before then, but not fine if you'd like to store them a bit more long term. Surely, the expiration dates will vary using pantry. I'm just saying that you never know. It's not like you can request a specific exp. date.

These look nice in the picture on Amazon, don't they? Well, they are exactly as nice as they look. I'm pretty sure the handles are made of wood. While they are nice and long ( the smallest one is 11 inches long) they are light. The brushes are held by what I think is aluminum or something similar.We are not professional artists, but I am a stay at home mom and got this assortment to use with my kids. They say in the description these are suitable for beginners. In my opinion this is absolutely true!My kids are using these for water colors and other "washable" paints. And as a testament of how comfortable these are to maneuver, my 3 year old can paint contentedly for 30 minutes without saying she is tired. For little kids it is also fun to "pick" a special brush for the day's activities and as they grow and actually paint pictures, then the different brushes come in handy.The brushes are made of different materials, different lengths, stiffness and so on. For this price each brush is less than $1 and they are nice quality. As a dollar tree aficionado, I guarantee you that these are nicer than any brushes you'll find there and a better value.I bought these brushes using a promotional discount for review and testing.

I have no complaints! This cinnamon tastes fresh and exactly like what I expected. I sprinkle it over oatmeal and hot chocolate. I use it in baking and to make French toast. It is loose, the right brown-reddish color and I am very happy that my container has an expiration date of three years from now! Very happy with my purchase.

I tend to switch shampoos every time I finish a bottle so I have used quite a number of them over the years. I color my hair regularly to cover grays and I have long thick straight hairThis shampoo has a mild scent that I find very pleasant. It is not overwhelming and does not linger too much. I know this is a 2 in 1 shampoo, but I always use a conditioner in addition to any shampoo so I cannot say if it will really condition by itself.I can say that I feel this shampoo washes the hair very well in one single use. For example, the other day my husband and I went on a date to a new restaurant. When we got home my clothes and my hair stunk of grease. It was so gross. I washed my hair with this shampoo once - followed by my usual regimen of conditioner. All the grease smell was gone. My hair was shiny and when I straightened it with the flat iron it looked just great.No complaints.

I've had this belt for a few weeks and I have mixed feelings about it.It has a strong Velcro closure that stays in place. However, every time I remove the Velcro the material gets fuzzier and fuzzier. I wonder how long this belt will really last. It isn't very expensive, so if you really want to wear a belt this will do. In particular this belt is excellent for those who only want to add that sauna effect around the middle. It really does make you sweat. The material has a faint chemical odor similar to plastic that I find unpleasant and makes me a little weary of wearing this on bare, sweaty skin. For this reason I only wore it once to work out. And I was really sweating. But I don't like the smell, so I would rather not wear it during a workout.It does not fit me correctly. My waist is about 8-9 inches smaller than my hip measurement (depending where you measure). It's fine if I only wear it above my hips. But then my lower belly bulges. If I wear it partially on the hips to cover lower belly, then the upper belly isn't as snug as I would like it to be. And it isn't like a corset for waist training, because it will bend with bulges and curves.So for me it doesn't work as I was hoping it would. I imagine men and women that do not have such different measurements between waist and hips would benefit more from this product.I received this product free for testing and review.

I had very high hopes for this program. I remember reading in the reviews here that this was confusing for children who were used to seeing dashed paper and they were completely right.My son was very confused by the inconsistency of where you are supposed to write your letters. On the same page, you will find the traditional two solid lines with a middle dash line (the kind of writing paper I used as a kid) right next to two solid lines, where you are supposed to write a "t" outside of these lines (see picture). If it sounds confusing is because it is!I've decided to use this book as a reference to have for correct letter formation and organic transition from letter to letter (when doing lower case letters it is best to write c before a). I know that you can find these references free online so I'm not sure how impressive this program is for us.I know this program is more than a workbook and includes pieces to form letters, an expensive chalk tablet and so on. I do not have any of those things. This review is strictly on this workbook. I feel that by itself is expensive compared to others you can buy (like the Kumon workbooks).I  am very disappointed and cannot give this a high rating. Perhaps this should not be sold by itself? Or have a warning?A positive: the paper is of very good quality and has many pictures that can be colored.

I first tasted these pureed carrots when my children were babies. This was one of the first foods my son had. I always tasted their baby food and I preferred the Gerber carrots to the carrots from other brands. These are a bit runny and juicy. Very easy for little babies to eat (and make a mess).I bought this large case of baby food, not to feed babies as my kids are now 3 and 5, but to add to baked goods. Because I actually used these as intended (for babies) I had some of these in the pantry when my oldest was 3 years old and going through one of those extra picky eater phases. He would eat cornbread and so one day I added his sister's carrot baby food to the jiffy mix. The result was very good! Not only was the corn bread less dry, it tasted better and looked better. From that time, I've added carrot puree to pancakes, sweet potato muffins and spaghetti sauce. This is easy to disguise to increase the nutritional content of what the kids do eat. So, I like to keep it in the pantry. I received eight 2-packs for a total of 16 individual containers of carrot puree.

When I first got these gloves I was unimpressed. They looked huge. I was disappointed because I figured they would only fit my husband. I'm the one that cooks around here and I've been doubling kitchen towels and dollar tree pot holders to get pans out of the oven for years now. I was hoping these gloves would be a solution for myself, not for once a year when I bake a huge turkey for thanksgiving and I get my husband to take it out of the oven.So the first to try out the gloves was my husband. He is not prone to praising items but he kept saying how comfortable these gloves were. I decided to try them on, and surprise! They are a little big, but snug enough that I would have no trouble using these on a regular basis. They are comfortable because they have some sort of cotton lining on the inside and they are cushy.I tested these gloves by cranking the oven to 500 F as we have no grill. I regularly use 500 F to finish off baked chicken to crisp up the skin (yes I bake chicken with the skin on - it's yummy). I have been burned a few times taking the chicken out of the oven as I let it cook in its own grease and removing a pan with hot grease using kitchen towels can easily result in burns. Anyway, I placed my hand in the hot oven for several seconds and it took about 15 seconds for me to feel any heat at all in my fingers. Not burning mind you. I just felt that I was touching something hot (yeah, a 500F oven lol). It started to get "hot" at about 30 seconds and I dare not test longer...  Normally you would have a place ready to place things you remove from the oven, no? 30 seconds is plenty of time. Even doing it slowly.These are very capable of protecting my hands from grease burns and removing hot pots and pans from the oven.These gloves may be hard to put on when your hands are wet and are perhaps not the easiest to put on and remove constantly. But the way I cook, I only need these to remove items from the oven or to move one to one side. I like they have long sleeves for extra protection.I received this item free for testing and review.

This drink tastes exotic, fizzy and delicious. While it is sweet, it isn't excessively sugary. This flavor, blood orange, pairs very well with red wine for a slightly sweet sangria.This is worth the splurge. It is much better tasting than orange soda. While it is 140 calories per can, you can be sure these are absolutely delicious calories. The best kind.Note: Amazon delivered this in perfect condition. I was skeptical but we had no trouble.

Can't go wrong with Nutella. I ate this as a kid and I'm glad it's become more commonplace. My kids like it on bread (who doesn't?) and on pancakes. This is also excellent on pretzel sticks and any salty cracker. I've seen a number of recipes that use Nutella too but it always seems like a waste not to eat it straight from the jar.The Nutella I got from Amazon feels a little thinner than usual. But it is summer and it could just be that it's hotter around here. It tastes exactly the same: equally delicious and addictive. The container is recyclable too.

Amazon, when a mother of small children orders Trix she does not expect "mini-Trix". I see in the description that the item may not be exactly the same as shown, but it makes me wonder if I want to bother with pantry any more. This mini-Trix may be amazing for teenagers who eat their Trix with milk in a bowl - but it is obnoxious for little toddlers who eat it dry.Don't get me wrong. I cannot return this because my kids were ecstatic. Little balls of Trix - how cute. Taste the same as the normal Trix, makes the milk pink (if that's your thing), they are crunchy and so on...But I'm really annoyed. Why? Because mini-Trix are really small. They end up under tables, stuck in between the legs of the dining chairs and I have to squat to remove them. They are balls - so they roll from wherever the kids are eating their dry cereal all over my open-living plan dining room, kitchen, living room. It's a huge area. It is annoying finding little balls of sugar, insect magnets, under furniture. I H-A-T-E mini- Trix. Sticky balls that cause rage. And trust me when I tell you, whomever thought of this marvel - stay at home mothers do not need anything else to clean up.A non-mother could maybe say that Trix is bad for kids anyway. And big Trix are still balls that still end up under furniture. Yes, yes true. But they are larger, easier to catch and see and easier for 3 year olds to grab and eat one by one in the car. This tiny things are just extra trouble, mess and stickiness.As for the healthfulness of Trix... Well I have nothing to say. I like them because they are a treat for the kids, come in fun colors and full happy mouths are quiet ones :)I gave this 3 stars because the product itself is fine and my kids will likely eat it in record time. But I did not order mini-Trix and I will not be ordering this again nor will I ever buy mini-Trix at a store for the reasons listed above. Maybe when my kids are older and less messy.Can you tell I'm irritated?

I love Dasani. Of the 'cheaper' waters, this is my favorite. To me it tastes crisp and exactly just like water should. I live in CA and while I drink tap water, I don't particularly care for the taste and so I end up drinking less than I should.It doesn't hurt that the bottles are nice and sturdy. So many cheaper waters have bottles so flimsy you can squeeze the water out by mistake. I like the convenience of grab-and-go. They are also recyclable.

Pros:1. While the lid is plastic, it has a no-leak seal and does not drip.2. You do not need to fill it completely with ice, if you leave some space it will easily mold to a knee or a cheek.3. It will stay cold for longer than an hour - we had our room temp at 75F when tested.4. It is better than putting ice in a ziplock bag for boo-boos.5. You can use it with hot water.6. With two kids in sports I can see using this often.Cons:1. When I first opened the package, this pouch had a stench of plastic. I put this away and several days later I checked and the smell was gone. It has not returned.2. After use, I drained the water (on my plants as I live in CA) and put it on my dish drainer overnight to dry. This item has so many folds that it was still wet in the morning. I find this irritating, but important to know. It can take 2 days to dry out. I decided to store it without the lid.I received this free using a purchasing code from an online deals club.Update:After several months of use I have increased my rating from 4 stars to 5. We use this A LOT. I've used it with hot water for cramps (great). Used it with ice and we all like that it doesn't sweat. This turns out to be a big deal to not have to wipe water off your boo-boo. It does take a while to dry (which was my original pet peeve) but I've had no issues with mold.

This is an ingenious organizing solution that does double duty because it will lay flat and the kids can use their creations on a surface with a road and train track.Most of the time though my son just uses this to put his Legos and Lego instructions away and it stays in the box shape most of the time. When it was new we played with it a little, but my son is 5 and not as impressed by the landscape as you may think.That being said, it is still a nice neat box with Velcro on the sides so the lid stays on. The zippers on the side sometimes unzip while he is playing, but it is not a problem to pull them back up. Overall I am pleased with the functionality and the neatness of it.I do not know how many Lego fit in the box. It is fairly large and I posted a picture with one of the Lego green building plates for reference.

Made in the USA, this shirt is 92% polyester and 8% Spandex. This means this shirt can really stretch. For this reason it is comfortable all over, including the arm band that is hard to fit for me.This shirt is rather form fitting so size up if you prefer a looser look. It is very flattering, airy and soft. This material is very opaque and does not wrinkle. The inside seams are well done.I own several eVogues shirts and this is one of my favorites. I normally order 1X and this one fits me as expected. I wear a 38 B bra (because I have never seen a 40B) and waist is around 35 in. I was a bit skeptical of the horizontal like-design of this shirt but it turns out to be very flattering. I am very pleased and now I know I need a couple other colors :)

I have five shirts from eVogues. I usually order 1X and some of them are actually a little loose. The fit on this shirt is a little strange for me. I read the other reviews and ordered a size larger, 2X. The cap sleeves are a little tight on my arms and the top part above the chest is a bit snug. Then it is rather loose on the hips! I think a 3X would have fit me better on top but it would have been too big on the bottom. This is strange as my bottom is bigger than my top. It's ultimately fine as I want to wear this as a cover for tank tops and leggings when it's hot out and it camouflages tummy. The little front pocket was a surprise. Somehow I didn't notice it while shopping.The material is nice for the price. It feels a little delicate, but not so delicate that you can't wear it to the park with the kids - which is where I'll be wearing this. I am 5'3" and change and this shirt stops slightly lower than mid thigh, which is nice if you want that look.I do not believe this shirt is a true plus size and if you are bigger on top with smaller hips I don't think this shirt would fit well. But, if you are pear shape this top would be great.I gave it 4 stars because I can see myself wearing this often as I want to camouflage certain areas but not be overly hot when it's 100F outside... But it's more of a 3.5 stars due to fit.

Feels okay on skin, no breakouts or irritation. Did notice a tightening effect but once you put moisturizer over it, that effect fades - and it's too dry to wear on its own. Overall, nothing special and probably won't buy this again.

I use these to pop over planters when the temperature dips at night in the spring/fall - pretty common occurrence here in the northeast. Will fit over smaller and even slightly larger diameter pots and height is good for all but very tall growing plants.  I tuck trailing plants under the cloche and pin in place with "earth staples".  Decent weight and like the adjustable vent on the top.

These are nice with the vintage look I wanted but the screws are way too long for typical kitchen cabinets or bifold doors....unless you don't mind about an inch of the screw sticking out of the back. In some cases, depending on where your holes are drilled, the extra length will keep the cabinet from closing.  Have to track down shorter screws to make these work.

I got these to cover marks behind the knobs on my bi-fold doors.  Being almost 3 inches in diameter, they do the job and matched the over-sized knobs I already had. Good weight/not flimsy.  Since they are large, would not recommend them for typical cabinet knobs.

These are nice looking shoes with stretch woven fabric uppers.  Tan color is great/a good neutral. The heel is flat/barely elevated in the back and the insole is padded though there's no arch support. For my slightly wide size 10 foot, the medium fit fine if not a tad short though it could be that the toe box is a little low - but I expect that to ease as these stretch out.  They kind of hug your foot and have a higher heel area that's padded so they feel good on. But because they are snug, doubt you could get inserts in here.  I like the "v" cut - makes my feet look a little smaller - and covers the bunion area without cutting into it. One thing to note is that the soles are slippery - they look like they have treads but they don't - so I'll have to put "grips" on them.

Merrell has been making this style sandal for several years...and some years they're a hit. other times a miss. This one is a hit - nice soft footbed with plenty of support, soft/flexible upper fits my slightly wide, high instep foot perfectly. No digging anywhere and sliding out when I walk. Good traction, too. Going to stock up!

These heavy glass knobs are quite solid and the metal portion has a nice finish.  They look great on my bi-fold doors and project just enough so you can easily maneuver the door. The included screw was a little long, so I had to put a washer in the back - but you could also add a rosette in the front (or find another screw...)

Liked the material (thin, crisp cotton) and pattern and thought the dress was nicely made, but the top portion didn't fit well. I would have had to hike it up at the shoulders (something I have to do a lot since I'm short-waisted) which would have made the armholes too small. Just want to note that the v-neck is deep.

I don't know what it is about this brand and this style, but they make my kind of big feet look pretty good. I ordered the wide for my slightly wide foot and ended up setting the front in the middle notch and ankle at the smallest. Even without much arch support, these are quite comfortable to wear. The strap at the toe doesn't dig at the bunion though sometimes my little toenail catches on it. Have 3 pairs of this style and wear them for summer casual and dress occasions. My feet are always very happy.

These are quite small and light - plus the french wire is quite small/short though they fit my ears fine.  The diamond is tiny but adds a bit of sparkle and I really like how they look on. Kind of pricy but they're a good basic and nicely made. Expect to wear them a lot.

These aren't as comfortable as I hoped - the footbed is not as soft as Skechers Go Walk slipons - but the fit is good and the upper is fairly flexible/doesn't dig.  They stay on my slightly wide foot/no sliding out. But I prefer Merrell's version over these and since I got those, I don't wear these nearly as much.

I thought all acetone based nail polishes were the same but was I wrong. Nail polish comes off quickly, no white film (that's what other nail polish removers did to my nails at least) and fairly moisturizing. Will never buy drugstore remover again!

Basic looking ballet flat with slightly higher heel that's very comfortable, soft foot bed, arch and metatarsal support plus covers the bunion area. Shoe is flexible with soft uppers.  No heel digging or slippage. I've had other styles with the knot at the top, but those dig into the top of my foot no matter how loose I make them.  These are suitable for casual and even some work situations (though I wouldn't wear them with a suit).I normally wear a size 10 and have a slightly wide foot with a high instep. In this brand, size 42 fits well.
Excellent insoles with proper support for my flat feet and a nice cushion-y feel - no hard edges/heel or rigid arch. Been wearing them for several months and they're holding up well.

I love using a Spoonk (an acupressure mat), so when I saw these (little spoonks for your shoes) I had to try them out.  Cutting to fit was easy and they feel great on your feet. Even with socks, you can feel the "pin points" - not painful at all - and I find my feet are less tired at the end of the day. Came back and bought another pair.

I never heard about this brand but was looking for some ponte pants and decided to give these a try.  Since I rarely wear tops tucked in, the very wide waist band was not an issue...but boy, does it hold you in!  Cut/fit is good and they wash well...though I do stretch them out/pull the legs to counteract the length shrinking.  (Wouldn't mind these in a tall/longer length.)  Great for casual or office occasions and very comfortable to wear.

For flats with no arch support or padded sole, these are fairly comfortable for times when you don't have to do a lot of walking. Width was good, heel didn't slip out and the cut of the vamp/side scallops don't dig the bunion area. Neutral light nude color is versatile for summer.  In this brand, I order a half size up to accommodate my slightly wide foot.

I always have to order a size up in slippers (11 instead of 10...) and while the length was good on these, they were a little wide overall with my heel slipping out at first....then it stopped after I wore them a while....but next day, same thing again.  They do make my feet look big (ummm...bigger, I guess)  - but they are comfy and warm in winter. But I like the Acorn sole which is tough enough to run outside and get the paper without slipping/feeling the pavement. They're also washable.

Bought these somewhere else in my normal size 10 but they were way too small!  Though the shoe was too short/tight, I liked how they felt -  soft insole, decent support, flexible feel and the vamp is high enough to not dig in the bunion area. Hoping the size 11 I just ordered fits since they're a nicely made, simple shoe and just what I was looking for.UPDATE:  I got the size 11 and the length is perfect.  Width wise, fit is good with stockings/bare feet but a little snug with socks. Kind of noisy due to rubber-like sole but I expect that to go away over time.

These covers are a slightly lighter version of another Classic Accessories cover (the tan ones) which I have had for a few years now.  They are well made coated fabric - a material "creatures" haven't been able to chew through like they do the vinyl/thinner covers. Like the tan ones, seams are tight and there are straps to attach to the furniture to keep them from blowing off.  Unlike the tan ones, these have "rope" like handles instead of fabric ones but seem firm/not easy to tear.Though this hasn't spent a season outdoors, I expect it to hold up just as well as the tan ones which have no tears, ripped straps or popped stitching - just some "drag" wear on the bottom of the cover which reaches the deck (really windy here so things get pushed around by nature a lot...). And I actually prefer the darker color - the tan ones get rather dingy after the first year - and will be replacing the tan ones with these.My only gripe is that they're only 24 inches high - something that seems to be the case for most table covers (tan ones were the same) - so the legs will always be exposed. Since I live in the snowy northeast, I usually buy a larger size to cover them.

True to size, well made and comfortable but like others have said, the bottom band does curl up a bit. It could be because I'm short-waisted so those with normal/long torsos might not have that issue. But since I don't wear trim fitting tops, it's not a problem for me and the overall comfort makes it a keeper for me.  Re the back smoothing, it does a good job of hiding the band line in the back (that doesn't curl up like the front).

Love Natori bras - fit is always good, no riding up in back or strap slippage and very comfortable to wear. Only issue with this style is that the hook and eye panel in the front is a little rough/scratchy inside. I put some Hollywood label tape over the area and now it's fine.

Well made sweater of medium weight knit that drapes well and is not too long or short. Hits mid hip on me (5'4"). I knew to order a size up to get a more traditional (looser) fit. Open portion at neckline (without buttons) is very flattering and lays flat.

Though these are for men, after trying the largest women's sized compression socks and finding them too tight/difficult to get on, I turned to these. I wear a size 10-11 shoe and have average sized calves (14 1/2 inches) and the Large size, though a little big, is easy to get on/off and still provides enough support for me.  No marks on legs either.  They wash well and don't loose their elasticity.

I've tried several heel lifts to correct for a 3/8 inch shorter leg.  This brand/style works and lasts the best.  I've been buying only these for the past several years and have yet to throw any out.You can peel off layers in 1/8 inch increments (4 layers total) to adjust the height. The suede top doesn't stick to the bottom of your feet or snag socks/stockings. They're also not too hard and I don't feel them as much as some of the harder styles I've tried.I buy medium size for casual shoes and small for dress shoes (I wear a women's size 10). I also put these in sandals and sling-backs using double sided tape to keep them from slipping around.  Unless the shoe sole is some odd material, I can usually remove them easily (tape may leave a mark) to use in another shoe.

These are a good fit for my slightly wide foot.  No digging in the toe area of from the strap across the instep and ankle area.  I like that these close in the back rather than at the ankle so I could adjust them for my narrow heel.  I did find the insole to be a little less "cushy" than other Merrell sandals plus it's a smooth material to which sweaty feet can stick. There's also not as much arch support as other models.  But they're comfortable enough for errands/at home.  The tea leaf color is a a dark camel.
Great, comfortable foot bed and good fit for my size 10 slightly wide foot but the straps just hit my feet and toes in all the wrong places.

I wear a lot of tunic tops and this long necklace is the perfect length for those but also looks good with shorter sweaters.  It's light but nicely made, smooth (no snagging) and hangs nicely.  While delicate looking, it's just enough to put on anytime and look like you didn't try too hard.

I haven't marked up and bent back so many pages in a book in a long time but I couldn't help myself.  There is so much information and insight packed in this book.  While the emphasis is on how technology has changed shopping habits, it also paints a picture of the new American psyche.  Social interaction, feelings of connectedness (or not), attention span, emotional intensity - technology has changed them all.  The author's contention is that understanding these changes is more important than big data when it comes to marketing since the accelerated speed of change makes predicting future behavior based on past data risky.There are numerous strategies for how marketers can tap into the consumer's psychology to gain their attention, trust and loyalty. But I read this book more to get an idea of how to recognize these tactics. The idea of using people's psychology against them to induce them to buy or believe certain things has always bothered me so I want to know what I'm up against.  I recommend this book for parents and teachers so that they can understand and mitigate some of the negative effects of this type of manipulation.

Loved this shoe.  Nicely made and stylish, just enough heel to wear with dress slacks or skirts.  Roomy toe box in spite of the slightly rounded point. But I couldn't get the right size.  My regular size10 was a bit too snug, 11 too big/heel slipped out.  No 10 1/2 available

Nicely made boots that look like they'd last a long time but I had a difficult time getting them on even with the buttons undone.  The opening was somewhat too narrow for my size 10 foot.  Once I got them on, I found the soles stiff and inflexible but the size seemed okay (did not use heavy socks).  Not a keeper for me.

This has a good amount of arnica for mild topical pain relief but the oil isn't slippery enough to use for more than a few seconds of massage.  I end up mixing this with another massage oil if I want to massage an area longer.  And I didn't notice any warming effect though that wasn't critical to me.  Overall, the effects last a few hours and worked well for some leg pain I had.

These are convenient alternatives to pureeing and freezing your own veggies and they tasted fairly "fresh."  They worked well in smoothies and juice drinks and the squash puree tasted fine in place of some of the oil in a batch of brownies I made. (You use about half the amount of puree instead of the oil, e.g., +/- 1/2 cup puree if you need 1 cup oil - so I use about half a cup of oil and 1/4 cup puree).That said, I found the portion size annoying.  There are 9 pouches but the nutrition info says 15 servings.  And each serving contains mostly vitamin A and not so much fiber so you're not getting all the "additional" nutrition you might think.  But sneaking in a little is better than nothing though at this price, I will continue to make my own.

This metal outer bird feeder holds a decent amount and the "hoods" over the perches do keep squirrels from easily getting seed. Smaller birds took to it right away.  However, larger birds were able to perch and actually pulled out one of the rods.  I used a piece of tape to keep it from falling out for now. The inner tube is a rather flimsy plastic that doesn't seem like it will last that long especially since several birds were pecking in that area trying to get to the seed.  Would spend my money on a different feeder.

This holds a lot of seed!  You pour it in by moving the red top and the seed will fill the bottom section first then the upper section/can't fill or empty one section at a time...so you'll need to empty it out by turning it upside down and shaking out all the seed.  Once emptied, it's easy to hose down and clean.  Would recommend putting a dome over the top or placing in a covered area since the seed can easily get wet.  While it's a bit of a pain to fill/empty out, have to say the birds love it.  Saw 8 Goldfinches on it at one time.

I got these for my husband who has has narrow foot. Thought they might be too wide, but he says they fit well and his feet don't slide out.  He loves the cushioning and can walk for hours with these.  The taupe color is a great neutral to wear with everything.

This small bag holds a lot more than I thought it would.  Lots of pockets/sections helps though if you fill it up too much, it can be difficult to easily slide things out (think of a wallet with tight credit card pockets...).  My only quibble is the handle which makes the bag a bit heavy.  But the chain strap looks good, stays on the shoulder and is easy to adjust.  Very nice leather and overall quality.

Nice, soft leather and size plus several organizer pockets but the placement of the handles at the top of the fold over flap causes the purse to hang in an odd way.  Doesn't seem to matter how much or how little you put in it. The strap placement also makes it difficult to get at the contents whether you're using the handle or shoulder strap.  Don't know why they didn't put the straps/handle at the side instead. Too bad since otherwise it's a nice looking mid-sized purse.

These sterling dangle earrings are quite substantial looking but not heavy at all.  The ear wires are a little wider at the top for a more secure fit that makes them not likely to slip out like other French wire designs.  Length is perfect for my kind of short neck - no shoulder grazing!  The shiny finish sparkles behind long hair.  Love them!

Couldn't wait to try this - really liked the concept of a tinted moisturizer for the body.  While the cream itself is nice and absorbs quickly, there wasn't much of a tint though it did impart a nice "glow."  As for a color build up over time, I didn't find that to be the case over the few weeks I used it.  There was no color "run" or staining though I'm not sure it's because there is so little color or because of the formulation.The reason I'm not likely to buy it again, however, is the overpowering fragrance.  If you've used Jergen's self tanner/glow, it's like that.  The smell dies down a bit but as I find in with the self tanner in the summer it reappears when you get warm.

Amplixin Volumizing Styling GelI have flat, baby-fine hair that breaks easily. Since I have been old enough to care, I have used a ton of products that promised to give me body, or volume, or texture  and for the most part, I had been disappointed. Amplixin is one of the few products that I have ever tried that actually really delivered on increasing on the volume and texture of my hair!Amplixin is a clear non-greasy gel that is applied to damp hair. The slick gel is not heavily diluted so a little really goes a long way for me. The gel has a fresh light scent with no overpowering alcohol base smell. The texture is slick and smooth with no tackiness to the feel. Applied to my hair in small amounts it does not increase drying time. Applied with a more aggressive approach the gel can be used to effectively style wet hair (this is convenient for me when Im leaving the gym  I use a little more than I typically would, comb into place, and Im good to go without having to take the time to dry and style).Amplixin creates volume and texture in my baby-fine hair. My hair looks and feels thicker, healthier, and is easier to style. Amplixin additionally gives enough hold that I dont have to use hairspray to keep my hair in place!I received the Amplixin Volumizing Styling Gel at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review and love the fresh scent, the non-greasy formula, and I especially love the way my hair feels thicker, fuller and healthier!

Security Decals for Commercial or Residential UseMy youngest son has a small antique store in a sleepy little eccentric town a few miles from here. Security isnt typically a huge concern for our store but lately the little town has experienced a rash of late night break-ins that are being attributed to some economic problems the area is having. We installed security cameras but hope to never have to use them to react to something that happens in our store. A while back I was being seen by a neurologist for Trigeminal Neuralgia. Before the MRIs, before the x-rays, before the host of prescription med trials, the doctor had me start on a prescription Magnesium supplement. Apparently nerve impulse transmission is directly impacted by magnesium levels and it is sound practice for people with nerve damage to take magnesium. The prescription that my doctor put me on was for 250 mg, and it was costly  and not covered by my insurance (because its also available OTC).When I started taking a magnesium supplement I learned that a LOT of people take this for a multitude of reasons  primarily the people that I know that are taking it do so to offset the insane risks associated with inflammation (everything from diabetes, to heart disease, to some cancers), as well as to help maintain healthy blood pressure. Also, one of my friends takes it because she is on a maintenance script for an antibiotic (to combat adult acne) and was told that sustained use of antibiotics contribute to a decreased magnesium levels.BRI Magnesium Citrate gives me all of the benefits of my prescription magnesium supplement, in a more powerful dose, at a lower cost  and I dont have to run to the pharmacy every 30 days, hassle with my insurance company, or wait on hold while the receptionist tracks down my doctor for refills.I trust BRI Nutrition to provide a high quality supplement that is made with only pure ingredients in a US facility that is FDA inspected. I received this excellent supplement at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review and love the smaller capsule size, that it is made by a company that I trust, and I especially love the health benefits that I get from using it.

Our construction company has a small fleet of corporate trucks. I know that if someone is set on staging an accident to fraud an insurance company out of money, in 8 out of 10 times they are going to target a commercial vehicle. For a lot of years we just simply didnt put commercially identifiable markers on the trucks  no advertising at all  in order to reduce the risk of being targeted by scammers. We knew we were missing out on an effective means of advertising our company but our insurance guy, and a lot of others in our industry, said that it was the safest way to go. Dash cams have changed that  high quality dash cams allow us to proudly display our company name and company information on our vehicles without worrying about being the victim of someone intent on filing a sham accident claim.Over the past year we have fitted all of our trucks with dash cams. We have bought a few different brands, with various features, as our needs  and the technology  has grown. Weve been pretty reliant on Garmin Dash Cams and have been impressed with the performance but were searching for an alternative that would offer better value with the same or better features and performance. Cradle and cables are good quality and are included.I received the AT55C Dash Cam at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review and am impressed with the quality of the unit, the excellent performance, the inclusion of tons of handy features, and the ease of use.

I was talked into going on a Relaxation Retreat by a good friend. I had visions of massages, drinks with little umbrellas, fuzzy slippers and binge-watching Netflix so I agreed to join her on this adventure. Apparently my idea of relaxation isnt even close to my friends idea of relaxation. The Relaxation Retreat involved showing up at 7:00 am on a Saturday morning (I didnt even know that Saturday mornings had a 7:00 am), in the gym of a small High School and sitting on scuffed gray floor mats with 17 other middle-aged women listening to a Mother Earth looking young woman tell us to breathe ourselves to inner peace. If this had occurred in the 1970s, the day would have ended in a smoky haze. Anyway, the one thing (the only thing) that I took away from the Relaxation Retreat was that the trend in these relaxation classes is for everyone to wear nasal dilators during meditation and relaxation breathing exercises to promote healthy breathing. As much as the philosophy behind it is convoluted, the science of it is sound  nasal breathing has benefits over mouth breathing  and when you effectively combine the two you have optimal breathing.I was familiar with nasal dilation devices: the Yeti that shares my bed has worn them with success to combat a wicked snoring challenge  but I had never thought about them in any other context. I received the Silent Angel breathing helpers in exchange for an unbiased review about a month after the Relaxation Retreat and thought I would try them in the manner that the breathing guru from the retreat had suggested. Im officially sold on the concept  they work. Opening my nasal passages changes the way that I breathe, changing the way that I breathe changes the way that I feel.The Silent Angels come in a handy little 2 clear plastic carrying case. There are 4 sizes of the Silent Angels in the case. Each one is a one-piece unit with two sections that are connected to each other. There is an excellent explanation of why people snore on the outside of the box. The Silent Angels are constructed from soft, medical-grade FDA-approved silicone that is non-irritating and comfortable to wear.Im excited that Ive found a safe and easy way to promote relaxation and feelings of well-being and I love that wearing the Silent Angels is comfortable. I have seen people also wearing these in the gym lately  I think Im going to try that next. Great product that seriously works!

One of my favorite people is a Fugitive Recovery Agent and he has a certain *style* relative to what he wears and how he looks. Im sure in certain environments his look is completely appropriate but when he is given the chore of taking me to the grocery store  young moms hide their children and other men wont look him in the eye. Its funny to me because this is the same guy that organizes many of the more successful charity drives in the neighboring community (and once organized a needlepoint craft show as part of a benefit although he will deny that one). Anyway, point is  he looks bad to the bone and dresses to maintain that illusion. I was creeping on his Amazon wish list page to try and get some Christmas gift ideas and saw he had saved the page for the fingerless tactical gloves.These Toncy Tactical Gloves are insanely masculine looking  jet matte black in color and rugged in appearance. Even with a tough appearance they feel like a dream  the outside has durable, super-soft leather that is flawless and the inside is lined with silky soft cotton. The quality is terrific: all stitching is double-stitched for extra durability and longevity, the seams are finished beautifully with exceptional attention to detail, and the adjustable wrist design allows them to be worn tight against the wrist so there is no slipping or chafing. I love the tight low profile of the protective EVA mats that will keep my friends knuckles armored during whatever activity he wanted these gloves for (I honestly have no idea  for all I know he could be intending to rescue stray kittens with them  I didnt want to give away the surprise, or the fact that I was creeping on his wish list page, by asking him).I received the Toncy Fingerless Mens Tactical Gloves in Black, size XL, at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review and love the excellent quality, the outstanding protective features, and I appreciate that they have a one year warranty. 5 gold stars for an awesome pair of gloves that I cant wait to give my friend!

It works!! I was soooo skeptical that bugs could hear (who knew?!). I honestly thought it was a long shot that anyone would ever spend the kind of time, money, and energy necessary to research what level of ultrasonic sound waves that bugs would not tolerate. I had underestimated the ingenuity of people.This electronic pest repelling device does something that (to me) might as well be magic  except it really works. I plugged the unit in at my sons little antique store, he gets inundated with pantry moths this time of the year. Within about 20 minutes of plugging it in, there were MORE pantry moths than ever. I thought yikes!  it makes a moth mating call or something but then read the information and this sudden increase in bug activity actually proved that the unit was working. See what happens is that the sonic waves disturb the bugs, they come out of wherever they are living/breeding/plotting against me/hiding and they fly around going WTH? They fly around for a while, hoping the sound will stop so they can go home. The sound doesnt stop and they get frustrated and go find new quiet homes, like at the neighbors or their parents basements.Anyway, at my sons store  the moths increased on the first day, a few days later they are GONE!Im especially surprised that something that works this good I honestly cant even hear  and thats remarkable considering that I have auditory sensitivities, and nothing about the sound has any impact on my little furbuddy either.Love this safe, easy, fast way to rid our store of those annoying pantry moths. I received this Pest Reject at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review. I, unlike a whole bunch of displaced pantry moths, absolutely love it!

These gorgeous blingy heart zebra decal stickers are EXACTLY what my old black leather tote bag needed!I have an old trusty black leather tote bag that I carry my work stuff in every day. My tote gets jostled around in my car pretty much non-stop and it now looks not only dated (I think I bought it when I still had a crush on Bon Jovi) but it also looks a little ratty. I received these gorgeous decal stickers at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review and from the moment they arrived knew that they had a new home fancying up my tired tote. One of the best things is that there were TWO of them! So I had one for each side of my tote. I peeled the backing off and pressed them firmly on each side of my tote and TA DA! My old dated tote has an instant facelift and is delightfully trendy now.At about 5 inches by 4 inches, these decal stickers are large enough to be eye-catching without being garish. I love the fun trendy design and the durability of the decals  the adhesive is strong, the colors are rich and vibrant, and the decals are beautifully made. 5 gold stars for a fast and easy way to give old accessories an instantly on-point fashionable look!

My kids game, a LOT  everything from League to Counter Strike to WOW to Minecraft  my kiddos have sacrificed sleep, meals and homework <sigh> to play them. They enjoy the time they spend playing, and they are particular about the equipment that they use to play. Both boys use high-end, top-quality gaming computers, and they insist that the peripherals that they use meet the same high standards. A week or so ago I received the EasySMX Gaming Headphones at no cost in exchange for an unbiased review and gave them to the boys to review. I was really surprised at how impressed they were  they are typically VERY difficult to impress! The features that these two gamers found important are: Sound clarity  Both boys mentioned that the sound is stellar. They described it as high-resolution sound. Appearance  Both boys also said that they love the look of these. This surprised me a lot, we have had other gaming headphones and the appearance wasnt important to them. Im guessing that since they were evaluating these together that they were able to actually see the other one using these headphones so they were more apt to really pay attention to, and appreciate, the high-tech appearance. Wearability  They appreciated the comfort and the fit  this also surprised me  they are different from each other in size, and they wear different hat sizes so the fact that both of them found these headphones really easy to wear was not something that I expected. Responsiveness of Controls  the younger one mentioned that the mute key and the volume control mechanism were really easy to use, and very responsive.Other informal observations that they made include; perfect cable length, lightweight enough to be comfortable without being fragile, and mic sensitivity is phenomenal.5 gold stars for a quality set of headphones that impressed two serious gamers!

The art of Calligraphy has enchanted me since I was a little girl. I love the beautiful way that a talented soul and a creative touch can turn mere words into works of art. I spent hours in my teens and twenties practicing letter styles  I enjoyed it so much but just never had the gift of talent that would transform my passable works to beautiful art. When my oldest son was about 21-years-old he found one of my old calligraphy pens. He picked up the pen, found an older bottle of ink and proceeded to create amazing examples of fonts that he has seen over the years. I was stunned, and extremely happy that he has inherited his fathers artistic talents. I was so excited to be able to give him this gorgeous and unique feather calligraphy dip pen set.This beautiful set comes complete with an excellent quality feather, the copper pen stem, 6 steel writing tip nibs in graduated sizes, a generously sized bottle of good quality black ink and a well-made wax seal in gold. The set is packaged in a handsome box and makes an exceptional gift.The pen itself is beautifully weighted and feels, and performs, exceptionally well. The steel tips are well made and they fit perfectly with no additional modification needed (other pens that Ive owned in the past needed a great deal of support to be used securely  this fit perfectly without any additional support). I was most surprised by the gorgeous presentation of the set, and the exquisite perfection of the feather quill. I received this set at a promotional cost for evaluation and an unbiased review and I am impressed with the quality and the beauty.

Immune system supports and anti-inflammatories are the two ways that Im playing dodgeball with Father Time. My favorite way to beef up my immune system is through higher intake of the fragile protein components and Premium Protein Smart Protein has the Proserum that my body needs. I love this dietary supplement for the absolute completeness of it  I havent found even a close second in the inclusiveness that Smart Protein offers.At one time I used a different product in my morning smoothies but found that the calorie content of the smoothie was just downright scary. Ive since modified my routine a bit and now just generously sprinkle my morning cereal with the Smart Protein: I get all of the incredible benefits without unnecessarily adding to my calorie intake.
