The results have been mostly satisfying.PROS:Most obvious-cost efficiencyGreat for toning/scuplting musclesWorks stabilizer muscles similar to free weightsDoes a fair job replicating cable exercisesFantastic build quality with fail safe design (woven inner core)Caribiner clips make for easy and quick band exchangeComfortable hand grips on pivot platformResistance ratings appear on par with free weightsMost versatile workout productExtra set of handles for circuit trainingNo need for a spotterCONS:Mounting options when using heavy resistanceDoor anchor not sufficient for top/bottom door mounting on standard doors when using heavy resistance (I have the welt to prove it)Door mount slides up and down when mounted to side of doorsEccentric contraction does not compare to other forms of resistance trainingNeed to add weekly protectant to maximize life of bandsOVERALL:The build quality and design of the Bodylastic bands is great and likley meets or exceeds any other bands out there. Being a therapist, I have seen many theraband strips made of similar material snap over time and the snap gaurd tech is a welcome safety advantage these have over  competitors. For the average individual, these bands offer the versatilty necessary to be utilized as the sole means to increase strength and maintain overall good conditioning. For bodybuilders, or anyone looking to bulk up, these bands are a good adjunct to your core barbell exercises (bench press, squat, deadlift, shoulder press) and offer a means to prevent loss of strength during prolonged stretches away from the gym like vacations. The primary drawback with this mode of strengthening is finding a suitable mounting option when using heavy resistance. For example, to perform tricep pull downs I have to use mount to the top of my solid garage door nearly flush with the door frame and deadbolted. Bodyelastics does offer a heavy duty door frame anchor, but I would be hesistant to utilize it on anything other than a solid door when using the amount of resistance I typically need to tire my muscles within 6-10 reps.  Simply stated, elastic bands are difficult to safely use when needing heavy resistance. I plan to buy some eyebolts and install them into a stud in the house for the ideal mount which will adequately replicate a cable machine for me. Due to the reasons stated above I really cant think of a need to purchase a larger resistance package than this one regardless of your strength with the possible exception of circuit trainers wanting several stations ready to go. If you are an experienced weightlifter and your idea is to replace core strengthening exercises with these bands you will be disappointed. However, If you go in wanting to change up your adjunct excercises, focus on isolated lacking areas, or maintain strength for extended durations between gym visits then these will meet your expectations. The build quality, design and veratility features of the product itself warrants 5 stars. Elastic bands as a form of strengthening exercise equipment as a whole 3.5/5 stars.

Being able to purchase a thermal camera at such an affordable price ($200 directly from Seek website) was quite exciting and as a whole the camera has lived up to my expectations. Flir was the first to bring a somewhat affordable ($350) thermal cam to a phone, but it was stuck to one phone model and a rather poor heat sensor resolution masked by overlaying onto a standard camera image. The seek is the current best value of all thermal cameras, but not without its flaws and with Flir's announced 2nd generation of the Flir One to likely be surpassing it when released later this year.DESIGN: The minimalistic design with a magnesium alloy body no bigger than your thumb is quite impressive. Despite it's small size the unit appears and feels sturdy with the only vulnerable area possibly being the micro USB adapter leaving a slight gap between the camera and phone when connected. A nice suprise is the excellent case included with the camera to ensure you can drop it in a bag or pocket and be worry free.FUNCTION: The camera performs essential functions most buyers would be using it for well. Temperature readings appear relatively accurate with the camera centered on the object. I do not have a high end thermal camera to compare it, but readings from human foreheads consistently read 96 to 97 degrees.  Viewing a half filled hot beverage thermos clearly shows how much fluid remains in the thermos. For the 1 functional task I used it in the camera served its purpose well allowing me to track down the area in my attic water was seeping through. Clarity of the image greatly dimishes beyond 8-10 ft but my dog in the back yard at night is easy to see and tell he is a dog from 50 ft away, of course items with less heat differential from surrounding are difficult to see as image. Although your not going to get the same image quality as multi thousand dollar thermal cameras, it is important to keep in mind even those will have worst clarity than your basic cell phone camera. There is a faint but audible continuous shutter sound the camera uses to recalibrate, but I did not find it aknowingly noticeable.SOFTWARE:  Setting up the camera is as simple as can be. Download the app, plug the camera in, it automatically opens the app and your ready to go. The software provides several setting to adjust color, although I found black and white contrast setting to provide the most detail and keep it on set on that option. There is a basic setting that simply provides the thermal image with no information, a setting with a centered crosshair marker indicating the temp, another setting to apply hi and low temp thresholds to only see images (in color) of items beyond or below a set temp and a hi-low temp setting providing two crosshairs that indicate the highest and lowest temperatures within the image. The high-low setting is useless at this point because of the tempurature gradient issue the camera presently has where there is always a 5-7 deg temperature diferrence from one side of the image to the other making temperature readings outside of the center of the field inaccurate. After contacting Seek, I received an email 4-5 days later stating a future application update would correct the gradient issue. That was over a month ago and no further app update has been released. I am doubtful how software can fix a problem that I perceive to be caused from the thermal sensors picking up some heat dissapated by the camera itself, but I confess to not be a technological expert and will have to continue to wait and see. The software does provide ability to record video and snap photos.OVERALL: Despite the temperature gradient issue, I can still recommend this product as a whole. It is still able to perform just about any useful purepose of a $1000+ thermal camera and is a breakthrough in bringing expensive tech to a mainstream price. However, if you can wait a few months I would wait for the release of the 2nd gen Flir One. It will provide all the same feature as the original Flir One with a thermal resolution in line with the Seek overlapped onto a higher resolution standard camera image in a similar form factor as the Seek (lightning and micro USB) and most likely without the gradient issue for a competitive price around $250.Note: Review based on use with a Samsung Note 3UPDATESeek exposed me as not being a technical guru as they released an app update correcting the gradient issue, thus eliminating the primary shortcoming. I am still interested in seeing the next gen Seek One with its overlapping image feature and a higher resolution thermal sensor, but would not hesitate in purchasing the Seek camera again rather than wait for Flir's upcoming release. There probably is not a better tech bargain out there.

My wireless IP camera days began about 2 years ago with Foscam 8918 followed by an upgrade to their 720p HD 8921 model. Although overall satisfied with the Foscam cameras, they both would frequently lose connection needing to be restarted before reestablishing a video stream. In January I purchased the Dropcam Pro HD which was quickly returned after finding no workaround from the need to add another monthly bill to provide any real utility. The Dropcam Pro HD may be ideal for a few, but most will find the Samsung to be a much better value. I'll try to provide a comparison hopefully helping prerspective buyers make the right decision.DESIGN: From a utility perspective both cameras offer virtually the same design with a similar mounting option and having a wide angle lens providing a great field of view without the need of pan/tilt feature as found of the Foscams. The Dropcam offers a minimalistic and sleek design. Using a combination of high grade plastic and aluminum makes for a well built camera that blends in with nicer environments well. The Samsung is a little bulkier and in typical Samsung fashion, rely solely on plastic for its construction. Despite the plastic the body is solid with good heft suggestion a good, albeit less attractive build in comparison to the Dropcam. The best comparison would be of a galaxy phone compared to an iPhone or HTC One. WINNER-DropcamSETUP: Setting up wireless IP cameras such as those offered by Foscam can be quite the challenge due to the need to create security loopholes in your wireless router necessary for viewing the cameras when away from home. Both the Dropcam and Samsung cameras make the setup so easy that you could have either up and running within seconds regardless of how technologically illiterate you may consider yourself. Both cameras even allow you to have the camera up and running without using a computer. However, at the time I hooked up the Dropcam, only the iOS app was able to be used for initial setup. The Smartcam allows you to setup the camera using either an iOS or Android device.  WINNER-SamsungIMAGE QUALITY: The Dropcam and Samsung both provide great day and night images relative to Wi-Fi/IP cameras. If hard pressed to choose which offers the best clarity I would have to say Dropcam edges out the Samsung. On paper the Dropcam has a slightly larger field of view. In reality I found no difference in the area shown through the video streams, but the Samsung somehow manages to do so with notably less of a 'fisheye' effect. Overall, I give the Dropcam a slight edge to the Samsung but definitely not enough to alone impact a purchase decision. WINNER-DropcamPERFORMANCE: Keep in mind that camera load time and stream delay will be greatly impacted by your internet speed and wireless router. For the purpose of my comparison both cameras were connected to the same internet connection on the 5Ghz band of the same router. The duration it takes to retrieve the video stream from the moment of launching each cameras respective applications is roughly the same. The video and audio stream of the Dropcam experienced about a 5 second delay. The delay of Samsungs streaming was notable shorter at about 3 seconds. Two seconds may not seem like much, but those are valuable seconds if using as a baby monitor and responding to a child in need. The Samsung camera has only lost connection once during the few months I've had it. WiFi cameras remaining connected has a lot to do with the stability of your internet service, but the Smartcam has been much better at keeping its video stream than my Foscam cameras. I did not own the Dropcam long enough to compare. If you notice your internet frequently dropping off or have to reset your router then you will experience problems with any Wi-Fi camera. WINNER-SamsungFEATURES: Both cameras have a built in speaker and mic with the Samsung offering a selection of 3 lullabies. The lullaby feature certainly is not much of a selling point for me as I assume it wont be for most others, but the speaker of the Samsung is louder and the microphone records louder when utilizing as an intercom. The Samsung audio stream plays loud enough for me to utilize the camera as a baby monitor without the need to hook my phone up to an external speaker, whereas, I needed the external speaker for the Dropcam to feel confident enough I could hear everything when in an environment with background noise such the TV. Recording capability is another essential feature of these cameras. If you don't need recording ability I would recommend sticking to traditional baby monitors to avoid the streaming delay altogether. This is the Dropcam's Achilles heel as it requires you to pay a $10 monthly charge as their minimum cloud recording package. There is NO way to record video without use of their cloud storage. The recorded image are accessable for a 10 day revolving window without any means to delete video that you prefer not to have other people possibly viewing. Samsung records video triggered manually or through motion detection to an on board SD card. Some people may fear if the camera is stolen, the evidence is stolen along with it, but images taken once motion detection is activated are automatically sent to your email.  WINNER-SamsungOVERALL:The cost of the Samsung Smartcam Pro HD after one year at $220 ($190 for camera, $30 for SD card), vs the minimal total cost of the Dropcam $300 ($200 for camers, $100 for annual cloud plan). At two years of ownership the Smartcam comes in at $180 cheaper. Each camera offers great hardware and have their strengths and weakness when directly compared but once taken in the total cost of ownership the Smartcam is a far better choice unless for whatever reason you have a need for 24/7 recording rather than relying on motion activate recording.

App will not install. Possibly related to Android 4.4 incompatibility but $30 is a lot to spend on an app that wont run.*UPDATE*Emailed Visible Body customer service regarding not being able to install over 2 months ago. Was sent an automated email stating it may take some time to respond as they were backed up, but no excuse for 2 months and no response. Too expensive for such lack of support.*UPDATE 2*Approximately 3 months after emailing customer support I received a response. The suggestions they provided to install the application had already been attempted. In fairness to Visible Body I would like to point out I have not responded back for further assistance as now that Essential Anatomy 3 has finally been released on Android I purchased it for the introductory fee of $10 and am 100% satisfied with that program.

The soft cover offers the following key features making its purchase a smart decision for anyone who owns or are looking at buying a Soundlink Mini:1.  It offers protection in all the right places while creating a bumper around the edges to protect the exposed grill.  This is vastly superior to the folding cover on the Soundlink II.  The Soundlink II leaves the prone to dings edges exposed.  As feared,  my Soundlink II shows signs of contact on its corners despite never realizing it had knocked into something.  I'm glad to be worry free about the same thing happening to my Mini with this cover in place.2. As expected it is easy to install and fits perfectly.  It retains the overall physical appeal of the speaker with the color choices adding a little fun to the classy look of the speaker.3. The price may seem a little high,  but if you consider the price of some phone covers it seems more reasonable.  I had initially planned on buying the relatively expensive travel case,  but after seeing how well this adds protection it has eliminated the need for that extra purchase.Sure I would have loved it if this came with the speaker to begin with,  but would rather it came with the included charging platform that would have likely been a much more expensive accessory if purchased separately.  The cover is designed well,  looks good and well worth the price.

This is my latest edition to my rediculous collection of Bluetooth speakers and truly stands out in the palm sized category. While I found Logitech's UE Boombox to edge out the Soundlink II in the larger category, the Mini Soundlink takes the thrown against the UE Boom in the battle agmonst the little guys. It isn't even fair to compare the Jambox to Soundlink Mini as the performance of the Mini is in a differen't league despite technically being in the same category of speakers.BUILD: The aluminum body of this speaker exudes premium craftsmanship as expected for its price and is notably superior to all but perhaps the UE Boom. The UE Boom is the only speaker I can give credit to as being equal in looks and feel, but edging out the Mini due to it's splash resistant design. I was somewhat surprised that Bose created a scaled down version of the Soundlink given its rather small size to begin with, but they were certainly successful producing a product that meets the portability standards set by the Jambox, altthough ever so slightly larger in dimensions.FEATURES: As with all Bose products, emphasis is focused on sound rather than features on the unit itself. There is no microphone for speakerphone ability or track controls as found on many of its pint sized competitors. It does include all the necessary basics like a button to easily pairing and storing up to 6 devices and of course an auxillary button for when you connect a player diectly to the unit as well as volume controls. Athough the battery life is rated less than the competition at 7 hours, Bose suprised me by including a unique docking station for easy charging. You just place the speaker on the station and it slides right into place with a little charm sound to let you know it's juicing up. I can say that the speaker was still playing after listening overnight surpassing the 7 hour mark at low volume. Although I was pleasantly surprised that Bose included (instead of charging extra) the docking station, it is worth noting no case was included and I have yet spent the extra money for one, although I did get the soft cover. The soft cover protects the prone to dings edges offering more protection than the folding cover of the Soundlink that leaves the edges exposed while protecting the grill.SOUND: Many palm sized speakers out there offer good mid and high range sounds similar to the quality of the Mini, but none have found a way to engineer decent bass out of such dimunative dimensions. At least not until now. In small to medium sized rooms Bose somehow managed to engineer this thing to produce bass that will satisfy nearly anyone regardless of speaker size. This is where it truly surpasses competition such as the JBL Flip and even more notably the evenly priced UE Boom. Granted the bass is toned down drastically when cranked up due to the sound processor protecting from distortion, so for large rooms or outdoors the Soundlink II or UE Boombox remain better options. The UE Boom does have the unique 360 deg output, but placing this next to the wall will still fill the room with the same volume of sound despite its unidirectional waves. If you plan on primarily listening to this thing in your bedroom, bathroom, office, kitchen...etc, you will not be left disappointed.OVERALL: This speaker is now my go to speaker for the bedside, get me going while getting ready in the bathroom each morning and serves as my primary travel companion. I'm satisfied enough to part ways selling my Soundlink II, while I'll still use the UE Boombox for Outdoors and driving my workouts in the basement.

This multi-tool proudly caters to a specific market and comes packed with just the right features to take care of an M4/AR-15 while still retaining enough all around utility to meet the needs of most without having to buy another tool to tackle the day to day stuff.  All the components of the knife are well put together without any play whatsoever to include it's hefty blade. There are a couple issues keeping this thing from being truly great. Closing the plyers takes too much oomph setting you up to have a finger pinched and the one star I knock off is for the cheaper grade of steel used for the blade.  For the sticker price of this knife there is no reason not to include a superior steel such as CPM 154 as found in the Charge lineup. Overall I would recommend this to anyone who owns guns,  particularly AR/M4 models,  and finds themselves adjusting or servicing them while out and about.

One of the few "free app of day"  that was actually worth installing.  In fact this app is worth more than the normal asking price.  I will not waste time by going into the details you can read in the description,  but what I will say is that this keeps my 3 y/o daughter captivated for quite sometime as she explores all the playtime activities she is able engage the characters in.  The animation is well done and the programming itself executes smoothly without error.  The only knock on this application is its limited learning value,  but there are plenty of other apps for that purpose.  What this app will do is buy you some time occupying your little one as you get caught up on things around the house.

The shealth does everything you would expect from an OEM product providing a good fit and care free durability. The size of the sheath is what limits its appeal. Thanks to the elastic sides the Mut fits securely but the sheath itself is significantly larger than it has to be. The Mut is a midsized multitool, but due to the uneccesary extra real estate of the sheath it carries like a large full sized tool.

Bringing back the stylus of old resitive touchscreen technology has come with ridicule, but critics could not be more wrong. Combining technology of old with todays technological advancements offers a new valuable feature set that sets this tablet apart from the mainstream. With so many tablets offering virtually the same real world performace and feature set, when one comes out with a unique feature set it makes the decision of which to purchase much easier. As long as you know what that feature set has to offer you.PROS:The processor and memory allows you to breeze through menus and execute any operation to include any app currently available on the market without a hiccup. The screen is bright and clear with no notable differences side by side with my daughter's iPad Mini. Battery life is on par of all the others easily getting through a heavy days work without charge. However, these are not the features that should draw you toward this tablet as many have these same bragging rights at a smaller price. The precise control of the Wacom's 'S' pen technology is its defining feature. You can truly use this to replace pen and paper when taking notes during a lecture or meeting. Try the same thing with your finger or fat tipped touch capacitive stylus and you will quickly be back to a pen and paper after your notes end up looking worst than a 5 year old writing with a crayon. Refining pictures on photoshop is quicker than on a computer with a mouse and again offers the precision unmatched by any other (non-penabled) tablets. The same thing obviously holds true for artists or doodlers when using applications like Sketchbook plus adding the utility of pressure sensitivity for accurate shading without having to contstantly adjust through the menu. In addition to the 'S' pen, the IR sensor is more useful than I had imagined. I easily added all my TVs,  Bluray players, projector, receivers organized by room even my 15 year old Aiwa system. Granted the app could be a little better by adding easier access to more controls for each device but does well enough to bypass buying a $100+ Logitech remote.CONS:Samsung fanatics ardently back the use of plastic to encase their premium devices, but the look and feel simply does not match the quality exuded by Apple products or Asus's infinity tablets. Although I would love for Samsung to take note and offer a premium casing to match the rest of the device, adding a quality case easily remedies this minor complaint.OVERALL:Anyone who wants to use a tablet for everything from an powerful productivity tool at work or school to taking full advantage of art and photo apps should look no further than this or possibly a Note 10.1. Personally, I have found the 8.0 tablet as easily useful as 10 inchers with better form factor to use on the go, but those who plan on using it for more for graphical design might want the extra real estate at the cost of resolution. If you have no interest in jotting notes, utilizing photo or art apps then save money and get a Nexus 7 or one of the other countless counterparts with similar features, otherwise look no further as the price of Note 8.0 is easily justified

I have somewhat of a wireless speaker addiction.  Always finding a way to irrationally justify the purchase of yet another speaker. I justified the purchase of this one for its ability to extend its battery life when listening outside on sunny days. The bluetooth speakers I have found to be my favorites are the Bose Soundlink II and the UE Boombox.DESIGN:The look and feel of this speaker definitely coincides with its price range offering great quality.  The size is a bit bigger than the UE Boombox and significantly larger than Soundlink II and Big Jambox,  but it certainly remains small enough to be easily portable.  Aesthetically this falls short of the other 3. Whereas the Soundlink II,  UE Boombox and Big Jambox all are equally impressive looking in their own right,  the Ruckus XL just doesn't really stand out. However,  if your like me you could care less on how it looks as long as its build quality is there and place a much stronger emphasis on sound.SOUND:On paper this thing stacks up with UE Boombox offering 2 tweeters,  2 woofers and 4 passive radiators which is 2 more than what the Soundlink offers.  Sound output from this is good,  but is not able to match that of the competition,  particularly that of the similarly priced UE Boombox.  At the lower half of the volume range with the bass boost on it holds its own offering a good range comparable to the other 2. The Rukus reaches a loud enough volume for large room but as you crank it up with the bass boost on distortion becomes notably apparent.  The max volume output from the significantly smaller Soundlink matches the Rukus without the distortion,  although the sound processor tones down the bass to keep it distortion free.  The Big Jambox reaches a similar volume ceiling with brighter highs without distortion,  but lacks the lows of the Rukus throughout its volume range. The UE Boombox again reaches the same volume output but keeps the bass without distortion. The most frequently commented negative feedback of the Boombox is it being too bass heavy. This might be true when listening right next to it,  but in open rooms and outdoors the bass is simply adequate,  far from overpowering.  Other speakers will leave most listeners wanting more oomph in larger spaces.FEATURES:This is wherenthe Rukus shines,  but how much of an impact they have is completely dependent on each person.  The most obvious advantage is the solar charging.  As far as solar panels go it works great but still has its limits.  Even on a sunny day capable of ramping up the battery's juice not too many people will leave this outside,  especially unattended for the 5+ hours necessary to charge and elect to use the adapter instead.  However providing some power to the unit while playing to extend its battery life is very useful when the weather conditions allow.  Another advantage is like Jawbone's Big Jambox the Rukus also has track control buttons lacking on both the Bose and UE. Personally,  I could care less about the playback controls since I control it on my media device,  but others might find them handy. I have never had any problems establishing a bluetooth connection for and of my speakers with my Android phone and iPod Touch with a similar range and the Rukus is no excpetion. One feature the Rukus XL is missing from its smaller sibling is the splash resistant protection,  which is odd due to it being designed and marketed as a rugged outdoor speaker.CONCLUSION:If you plan on using your bluetooth speaker primarily outside in a sunny climate and don't mind sacrificing sound quality at higher volumes, then this speaker is for you and you will likely be quite satisfied with its performance.  If you don't think you will take advantage of the solar charging capabilities or simply want the best sounding speaker,  particularly in large spaces like outdoors,  then the UE Boombox is a far better choice for nearly the same price.  If ease of portability is important to you with exceeding sound quality then the Soundlink II will be a better choice although quite a bit more expensive.  If your looking for a bluetooth speaker with sound and build quality equivalent to the Rukus XL without the solar panels,  then I suggest taking a look at the original Supertooth Disco and save $100.

DESIGN:This is the most well designed outlet arrangement I've seen on a surge protector. Thanks to the number of outlets and the pivoting heads,  I can fit at least double the number of electronics with large adapters when compared to any other surge protector I've use.  The unique looking popular round surge protector with rotating heads caught my eye,  but it only contains 6 outlets yet takes up more floor space and costs more.  The Belkin may not look as cool as some of the colorful Monster brand protectors, but the functionality and price of it cannot be topped.SURGE PROTECTION:I tested this out on an outlet that has had problems with surges every time the washing machine kicks in.  I had a cheap surge protector plugged into the outlet loaded with a couple phone chargers and a touch lamp plug.  Everytime the washer changes cycles the lamp turns on or off.  With the Belkin plugged in the light no longer turned on/off during washer cycle changes.  Sure this is a simple test,  but at least it indicates the surge protection is funtional. I would recommend this surge protector for any area requiring the use of numerous electronics such as a computer desk or entertainment center.

These straps are great for the general purpose of organizing entertainment center cords,  computer system cords... Etc.  My intended use for these straps was to manage cords for medical equipment during travel.  The worn straps these were to replace looped onto a cord before wrapping allowing it to stay in place when the cords are released.  Unfortunately,  these are missing that same basic design feature making them more likely to get lost as you need to secure it everytime you release the cord,  whereas other velcro straps remain secure at all times.  Not a big deal if you just want to organize cords of stationary electronics,  but then again for that purpose you may as well save a few dollars and buy a bag of classic zip ties.

Paying. 99 cents for this app is a fair price for what you get,  but at full price I would find this game seriously lacking.  The strong point of this game is that it is simple enough where a 3y/o can grasp the concept and play it.  The weak point is the lack of depth it has offering little replay value.  Most of the five games are the exact same with the exception of animation.  For example,  they will swap out donuts for balloons and refer to it as a different game whe having the exact same gameplay.  There are far better options out there for child entertainment apps with better lasting appeal while actually including some educational value.

Cathryn Fox is an author that takes sensuality to a whole new level. Her books take you on a journey of escape. Reading her stories are like stepping outside of yourself and experiencing emotions that are surprising and satisfying. I received an ARC of Sweet Ride in exchange for an honest review. A short, sweet shock to the system. What her stories may lack in depth they make up for with seductive characters and sticky situations.

With The Hometown Hoax, Ms. Thurmeier composed a story that is somewhat idealistic but cute none the lest. This read reminded me of the saying " one person's junk may be another's treasure." Tessa saw Cutter's Creek for everything it lacked and was not. Maybe because it was her hometown and she wanted more than to be cut off from new experiences, new people and a different environment. Logan saw it in the opposite way because he had already experienced fast paced living and adventurous experiences. The Hometown Hoax is a story of perception, deception and distinguishing between the two. I received an ARC of this story in exchange for an honest review. The heart of this book is finding out what is most important.

The past few weeks I have spent becoming acquainted with quite a few new authors. One of the stand outs has been Victoria James. I was introduced to her work by a friend and had to catch up on what I had been missing. The central theme in her works is the power love has to influence so many areas in life. She writes about characters that are easy to relate to and that is what makes her stories such precious finds. I received an ARC of The Billionaire's Christmas Proposal. I love how she creates family bonds through enduring friendships and helping hands. With her stories you become so invested in the stories that it is hard to leave when they end.

A.J. Pine examines love in this comical, emotional and entertaining read. I Do gives a whole new meaning to the saying "through the eyes of love". Ms. Pine invites of into the lives of four couples as they journey through the pitfalls, rewards and baggage that love entails. Set in motion by the pending nuptials of close friends each couple starts to question and take her closer look at the relationship they are in flaws and all. I received an ARC of I Do in exchange for an honest review.

Beauty and Boss is a modern twist on an age old fairytale. I have read a number of of stories and seen many movies with Beauty and the Beast as the basis for them. Diane Alberts foray into this arena is well deserving of praise. She took the story gave it a sultry finish and presto it worked. The longing felt between Maggie and Ben is eerily heartbreaking. The heat between them is impossible to ignore. I received an ARC of Beauty and The Boss in exchange for an honest review and will never look at the story in the same way.

A delectable face-off where the winner takes all. Ryan and Chloe had so much electricity the aftershocks strengthened the blaze. Chloe is just like me, if you try to force her into a corner she is going to come out swinging. Ryan wants to do more than spar with Chloe. He is looking for an outlet for his frustration, uncertainty and something that will make him feel alive again. I received an ARC of Once Upon a Play in exchange for an honest review. Explosive chemistry, passionate characters and heated storytelling, all the makings of a memorable read.

Rafe and Chelsea need each other in more ways than one. Compromising Her Position is engaging and humorous. An all around good time. There are scenarios that have been written about a number of times and never get old. Samanthe Beck has found one of those with this read and made it her own. Mistaken identity leads to hilarity, lust and romance. Nothing original. Has been done before but liked it none the less. I received an ARC of Compromising Her Position in exchange for an honest review.

Talk about a bait and switch. I received an ARC of Tell Me You Need Me in exchange for an honest review. Chloe and Gage were centered on getting what they wanted by whatever means. The lengths that they went to were over the top, kinky, sexy and so funny that I laughed so hard I cried a couple of times. Joya Ryan has done it again. A seductive and appealing tug of war between dominant characters who fight to win. I loved it. It hit just the right spot.

When I was presented with the opportunity to read the first book in the Sin City Seals series: To Tempt a Seal was the first time Natalie was introduced. To Tempt a Seal was her sister Lucia's and Natalie's best friend Cade's moving story. She was the protective older sister who unwittingly played matchmaker. In To Dare a Seal Natalie gets her own story. Natalie uses her touch girl persona as a shield. She feels deeply and struggles with guilt for not being able to protect her baby sister from the evil that she faced at an early age. Pain for how she lost her parents when she needed them most. Anger for the things in her life she has had no control over and irritation for the one person who will not let her wallow in self-pity. I liked Jack. Beneath the gruff and overtly sexual exterior he was a really sensitive guy. Natalie was his dream girl that he wanted for his reality. Sara Jane Stone has done a really good job with this series. I received an ARC of To Dare a Seal in exchange for an honest review. To Dare a Seal is heartbreaking, irresistible and sexy. I enjoyed every minute of this story.

Blake is a man who has business and the bottom line on his mind all the time. He thinks with his head and does not his feelings decide his actions. Kira is a person who cares about more than the ending balance on her bank account. She leads with her heart and her charity work proves that. Blurring The Lines is a look at what happens when two immovable forces collide. There was more to Blake than Kira realized. Marisa Cleveland's story of how preconceived notions can lead to passion and understanding. I received an ARC of this light hearted entertaining read.

There are so many aspects that I love about Melissa Foster's novels that it would be too hard listing them all. Of course the love story is a plus. Seized By Love introduces Lizzie and Blue. Lizzie is a woman who has lots of love to give but responsibilities throughout her life have caused her to turn inward and rely on herself to look after her loved ones. When Blue looks at Lizzie he sees a women who is in need of TLC. He wants to take care of her and show her she does not have to do everything alone. Melissa Foster got right to the heart of the story from the first page. Seized by Love is about learning that hardships don't have to be faced alone. It's okay to ask for help and to open up and let love in. As with all of her books Ms. Foster created a love story that was sweet and emotional. I like that she also created a character that put family first.  Reviewed for Beck Valley Reviews
Brenda Novak has a way of telling a story. Small town life, emotional reads and exceptional characters. It's no surprise that A Winter Wedding is a well written read.

There is mischief afoot on Candy Cane Lane. The holiday has made it's way to this magical town again. Sheila Roberts put her best foot forward with Christmas on Candy Cane Lane. The characters are charming and the setting is picturesque. There is something for every lover of books. Tilda is thrust into a world of family and traditions while working to sort out her love life. There is romance, drama and amusement in every chapter. I received an ARC of Christmas on Candy Cane Lane in exchange for an honest review. This story embodies the wonder of the holiday season.

I am a strong believer in strength of character. No individual knows how they will handle a situation until they have to face it head on. Jane is my hero. She dealt with a major JA for years and then was tossed aside like trash. This is a woman that had the rug pulled from under her yet she handled it with grace and strength. She learned from her past mistakes and with the help of an old friend may find a new chance at love. Hope Springs on Main Street is a story that is not always sunny but just like Jane leaves you feeling stronger for reading it. This is my first read by Olivia Miles and I am so grateful to have discovered her work. Received an ARC in exchange for an honest review.

Every Little Kiss by Kim Amos is a fun, light and sexy read. A woman searching for a good time. A playboy that wants to show her one. Casey came across a running away from her responsibilities. Abe was the good time guy. Always ready to have fun. What I found really amazing is by the end of the story the playboy wanted stability and the usually responsible Casey wanted anything but to be tied down. With identifiable characters Kim Amos created a read that is unforgettable.

I have not had the pleasure of reading the previous book in this series. If I had maybe I would have learned more about the history of Ben and Paige's relationship. I enjoyed them as a couple. There was more going on underneath Paige's resistance. Paige is scared to open herself up to more hurt. Her relationships whether romantic or familial have consisted of her being labeled a disappointment and I believe she has taken those words to heart. In her mind she can't disappoint anyone else if she pushes them away. Ben would not have been my choice of her rescuer but he ended up surprising me. Something Like Love takes a look at the fragility of the heart and the power love has to mend it. I am going to read book one as soon as I can.

From the moment I found out about What Happens Under the Mistletoe I knew I had to have this book. Containing some of the most prolific voices in historical fiction and regency romance makes this read a serious plus. A celebration of love, life and the magical blessings the season brings. On a cold night, What Happens Under the Mistletoe will take the chill away. I received an ARC of this story in exchange for an honest review.

I'll Be Home for Christmas made me feel sentimental. Lori Wilde has a way of bringing her readers into the story. Although emotions play a large part in her stories, each read has it's own personal message. The message of this read is family is important but love is key to happiness and stability. I'll Be Home for Christmas is an ideal edition to Ms. Wilde's Twilight series.

Sake was a very memorable character. A product of a sordid affair she carries the heritage of two cultures on her shoulders. This young woman endures so much hurt and shame in her life she struggles with her true identity. This proves even more difficult when she is thrusts into the public eye as the secret love child of a wealthy vineyard owner. In order to find her future, she has to face her past. What I like most about this story is that nothing came easy for Sake she has had to fight for everything but doing so has given her a deep appreciation for others and helped her to become the strong woman who learns to face her fears. I received an ARC of A Taste of Sake by Heather Heyford in exchange for an honest review. A romance that proves deeper than a love story it is also a story about a woman learning how to love herself and accept all that makes her unique.

I am really enjoying reading stories where the female characters are just as central to the canvas as the male ones. Within Scandal Takes the Stage, Eva Leigh constructed a character that is focused, brave and heroic. I don't want to give away the story. What I will say is that being true to the heart is what I took away from this. The value of following your dreams can be rewarding.

very easy to use, just screw some small hooks that are included into the ceiling and hang it up.  seems like a princess bed and does not have to droop in the middle as shown unless you want it to.  You make it as droopy or as tight as you like.  I bought one for my girlfriend who just lost her husband and it makes her feel very cozy.
lightweight and comfy, not sheer at all, I bought the size I normally do and fits fine even after washing.  love the colors, the photo doesn't do justice and the pricing is amazing
well made, nice selection, great pricing, very happy and would recommend
beautiful and great pricing, very happy with purchase
well made, beautiful colors, great pricing, very happy with this purchase
very cute, well made, a little pricey to me, but it's for my sister's birthday and she's worth it.  I could not make money using this bead for my jewelry making business, but it is higher quality.
very cute, well made, a little pricey to me, but it's for my sister's birthday and she's worth it.  I could not make money using this bead for my jewelry making business, but it is higher quality.
very cute, well made, a little pricey to me, but it's for my sister's birthday and she's worth it.  I could not make money using this bead for my jewelry making business, but it is higher quality.
very cute, well made, a little pricey to me, but it's for my sister's birthday and she's worth it.  I could not make money using this bead for my jewelry making business, but it is higher quality.
very cute, well made, a little pricey to me, but it's for my sister's birthday and she's worth it.  I could not make money using this bead for my jewelry making business, but it is higher quality.

unique bottles, many uses - add glitter to cooking oil or water, add food coloring to cooking oil or water (when using liquid - use waterproof glue for cork), tiny flowers, antique labels, even just oil and water can look interesting.  Make great necklaces, key chains, home dcor - ideas are limitless.  Love to use my creativity with these

Had used the circular trays before, but I think I love these just as much.  very well made, very well priced and infinite possibilities of what could be in them - baby photos, baby's first lock of hair, stickers, sayings, mini artwork and could be used with or without the glass covering, but if not using a glass covering, seal it somehow for best results

looked everywhere for these, love them!!!  You can sort colors or use as multi-color.  I use them in clear vases for fresh and silk flower arrangements.  I use them in tiny vials with cork for unique pendant or keychain.  Fun for all ages!
stunning rhinestones, very well made, stick to about anything easily and are also very easy to use. I would recommend these for many purposes.
love these, get many, many compliments, so decided to make some for my friends.  will be buying more soon, really great gift idea for birthdays, Mother's day, or for yourself.

wore to church on Sunday with black leggings and teal scarf - got so many compliments I may wear it every week.  Super soft material,  easy to care for and looks fabulous - covers everything I don't want to show.

beautiful red color, large enough my feet don't stick out when I stretch out, extremely soft and comfortable, well made, easy to wash.  I most like the softness and the size - so many personal blankets don't cover well, this does and is beautiful enough to leave out on couch or chair as accent.
bought for one granddaughters birthday, then when the next one had a birthday, had to buy another.  really cute and nice size, very soft removable pillow case.
love these necklaces, very well made, exact color and length I wanted.  Pricing allows me to continue to make jewelry while having arthritis developing.  really great help to me.

super cute, endless possibilities.  have put glitter and water, glitter and cooking oil, cooking oil and water, colored water, colored cooking oil, small beads, mini terrariums, sand, colored sand, tiny seashells, tiny silk flowers and even baby's first lock of hair - go wild people!

I got this for free from Amazon, along with the Orb-3 Water Garden Enzymes.  It's tough to rate either individually, because I used both together, but I can say that the products appeared to work as advertized - the water in our pond has become clearer (it was a bit murky to start with), and the muck that was starting to form lessened.  Moreover, we haven't had any fish deaths - we had a spate of them prior to using the Orb-3 products.This is a big bottle, so while it might appear expensive at first, keep in mind that it will provide you with many months of treatment.In all, a decent product at a fair price.  I wish I could take longer to write this review, because I would like to see how things shake out after a few months of using this stuff, but Amazon says I need to finish reviews in 30 days...

This is a very nice light.  I have been switching over all of our lights in the past year - at first to CFLs, now beginning to slowly move to LEDs.  With that, our electricity bills have dropped a decent amount, despite an increase in electricity costs in our area.  So I'm clearly biased in favor of this light to start with, because it uses a comparatively miniscule amount of energy.As compared to CFLs, the light from this LED is brighter and more natural.  It also lights up immediately.  Also, for whatever reason, many of the CFLs I buy don't last as long as they should.  I have yet to have to replace an LED light, though.The only drawback I see to these lights is that, at slightly over $25.00 a pop, replacing a lot of lights in your house can be quite an expensive proposition.  Because of that, I'll be taking my time to switch over.  Nonetheless, the Ecospiral LED is definitely going to be on our list of preferred bulbs during the transition.

So Amazon sent me one set of towels for free.  I think I'll order more, because these are pretty nice - an attractive color, softer than our old towels, and highly absorbent.  A great combo.  Through Amazon, they come at a decent price.  They're also partially made of recycled cotton yarn, so I feel decent about that because that saves a lot of water as compared to non-recycled towels.All in, taking into account the price, the recycled yarn, softness, and absorbancy, I'd say these are good towels for the money.

Sweet.  Spicy.  A real surprise.  Not an overpowering spicy, but not wimpy either.  A spiciness that just sort of creeps up on you, but leaves you wanting more.To be honest, when these arrived in the mail my wife was highly critical.  Then she tried them.  The jars were gone within a couple weeks, as she used them in a wide variety of dishes, some of which I never would have expected (example: sprinkled over salmon?).  In each instance, they tasted great.We are ordering more of these - my wife insists!

This book has it all.  Lots of pictures and graphics (mostly in the form of battle maps) about World War I, of course, but it also covers the many different theaters where battles were fought, looks at the roots of the war, and gives a nice overview of the entire campaign.  In my perspective, this isn't for someone who is looking for a "deep dive" into the war, but it's a great book to curl up with your kid, look at the pictures and read about the many, many aspects of the war, many of which aren't even covered in school any more.  From that perspective, this is a really good book and one that has given my son and I hours of enjoyment.

Let my start off by saying that there is ample scientific evidence of the benefits of probiotics.  Simply google gut-brain-skin axis, for example.It's also clear that many people don't get enough probiotics.  Although yogurt and kefir are great, most of the bacteria they contain die in the stomach due to acid.  Pro-15 has patented a delivery system that (allegedly) ensures that more of the bacteria make it through to the intestines than other methods - 15X more than capsules.Pro-15 carries more types of probiotics than other sources.  For example, Lifeway Kefir has 12 probiotics, NutriGold Probiotics Gold has 6, and Schiff digestive advantage has 1.  Moreover, the strains in Pro-15 are not only those that allegedly help digestion, but others such as L. reuteri and L. rhamnosus that have shown promise in helping with allergies and skin conditions such as rosacea, eczema, acne, athlete's foot, etc.It's early yet for me to draw any firm conclusions, but I can say that my skin is doing better than it has in a long time - no more eczema outbreak, rosacea under control, etc., and I do _feel_ like I have more energy.  I made it through the most recent allergy season with nary a sniffle, let alone some of the bronchites I've had in the past.  So while I can't say for sure that Pro-15 works, there are positive signs.  I will definitely keep using it.UPDATE August 7, 2014I've been taking these for a few months, and I definitely feel different.  Unlike many posters here, I don't have a history of digestive issues.  That said, I am sleeping much better, I feel as if I have more energy and less desire to snack.  No sign of any sort of illness, and some nagging issues, such as some joint pain, have vanished.  I can't say that's all attributable to the Pro-15 pills, but I'm not going to take any chances and stop taking them!

This is a nice coat at a nice price.  We got it for my son during one of the coldest winters on record here in the Midwest, and despite the absolutely frigid tempuratures he never had a complaint about the cold.  The fabric does not appear to stain or spot, and the parka is durable enough to survive the winter without a mark or tear - shocking given that every single pair of jeans my son has have at least one hole in them.The price is far better than comparable parkas from local stores.  Suffice it to say that if we need a new parka (because my son outgrows or loses his), we'll get another one of these.

This is a great product at an attractive price - a lot of stores sell these stickers for $1.00+/package.Keep in mind that you'll need to get the Panini sticker book as well (it should cost all of $2.00).  In all, if you want even a remote chance to fill the sticker book you'll probably need to buy 2 boxes of these stickers, and that assumes that there are almost no duplicates.  In reality, you'll get lots of duplicates, and there will be some stickers you just won't find, try as you will.  That sounds like a complaint, but it's that way with baseball cards, etc.The stickers themselves are fairly small headshots of the players.  It can be a bit tough removing them from the backing, but they affix easily to the book's pages.  Each sticker has a number on the back, so you can quickly locate where it should go.The real delight about the stickers are how my 7 yo son and I spend time together.  He loves to open a pack - spread out the 7 cards.  He often recognizes the stickers he's already got.  He quickly turns the pages to the one where the sticker should go (so this has led us to discuss counting large numbers).  We also have discussed the geographic locations of the various teams (there are maps for each FIFA region), how they got into the World Cup, and other background.  So this is also educational.At the end of the day, filling a book will be fairly expensive, but I can't put a price tag on the time my son and I have spent together because of the Panini stickers.

The shoes are great - they don't have laces, they fit easily, they are stylish (to a young boy), and they are very durable.  The sole proves very good traction, and the canvas-made upper allows breathing.  Dirt doesn't really show on them, and mud washes off easily.The price, when bought from Amazon, is quite attractive.What's not to like?

This book presents a great roadmap to help players develop long-term.  To explain that, I need to take a step back.When I played as a kid, long-ago, most "American" teams played a poor version of English "kick and chase" soccer.  There were fast forwards and every time a team got the ball you'd hear cries of "kick it."  Long, aimless kicks to nowhere were greeted with cheers, despite the fact that they accomplished nothing.More recently, many teams have begun to emphasize footskills (a/k/a the "Coerver method").  So now some teams that aren't playing "kick and chase" are churning out kids who dribble with their heads down and use fancy moves all the time, sometimes at the wrong time.  The idea is once the kids learn the footskills you can begin teaching them about the larger game.  There is some merit to that position; however, when a kid's mechanics are such that he/she has his/her head down all the time, and she's not taught other aspects of the game until older, he/she might not make the leap to becoming a more complete player.Harrison's book represent, to me, the next step in American soccer.  Rather than teaching simple footskills and repetitive drills, he emphasizes awareness of the game in the context of both on the ball and off the ball movements.  His theory (one that I agree with) is that without understanding the bigger picture, players won't reach their peak development.  As such, the book represents the next step from kick and chase and Coerver-type play.I still believe that footskills are important to teach, and there's room in any program for Coerver type exercises, particularly when kids are trying to master a new skill.  The merit to Harrison's book is that, after the initial skill is learned, he layers on awareness exercises.This is not a program for coaches looking to win immediately.  In fact, it's probably the worst of the 3 programs mentioned above if a team wants to win NOW (you'd be better of sticking with kick and chase).  However, if you're looking to target complete 14 or 15 year old players, starting at U-10 or earlier, this book merits a long look.If you are looking at this book, I would also recommend Horst Wein's "Game Intelligence" and "Developing Youth Soccer Players" and Schreiner's "Perfect Ball Control."  The "Perfect Ball Control" exercises complement many of the exercises in this book quite well, and Horst Wein is known as the "Coach of Coaches" for a very good reason.In all, if you are concerned about long-term player development, this is a GREAT book.

I just got this game this as I really enjoyed the first Lifeline. I have not gotten too far into the game but already I've come across a few minor irritations. First off, this is not like the first where you're assisting someone, like, Taylor, out in space which is fine.The part that irritates me is that this is a story of a mage trying to avenge her parents and reunite with her brother. They talk about spells and magic and the like which is very interesting because it's introducing you to her world but it in the midst of all this we Arika makes mention of some mainstream stars and movies like John Cusak and Kevin Costner as well as the Jedi Knights and Professor X. This really takes away from the feel of the fantasy we are supposed to be believing. Okay, her world exists in ours but that, I find, is another detraction. Why mention Oregon, Washington and the Atlantic when you could have just as easily created your own world. To me, it would have worked better in a world of its own. And if you did want to make this take place in our world at least leave mainstream out of it due to the nature of the story itself.Overall, I am enjoying it but not nearly as much as the first. The soundtrack is good though and the story is at least interesting enough to keep me going for now. I will update as I go.

While the game does look legit and plays nicely enough it has been confirmed to be a pirated version, again. These fakes are getting more advance by using the developer's name, same price, and list of achievements making it look like the real deal. Seeing all this I decided to take the plunge and purchase it since it's one I'm highly anticipating. It did play nice enough but I decided to contact the developer for confirmation and was told that it is indeed a fake. The developer has not released it on Amazon yet. Hopefully that will be rectified soon as I'm sure I'm not alone on wanting to purchase it.

Amazon has definitely been getting better with their shows. Between Man in the High Castle and this one alone I can find shows that will certainly keep bringing me back for more. I love period shows and even better when they have good execution and this definitely had that! Acting was superb and I, for one, cannot wait to see more. My only one criticism is that I felt half hour was not enough. I'd love for this show to be at least 45 minutes per episode. Regardless, I believe this show deserves to be picked up.

I just received this set yesterday and it is just as sturdy as the others. I can't believe my collection is almost complete. This is a great collection for all fans of the strip and I, for one, am proud to own them. Beautifully done as always.Now for the good part. Fans of the collection have been curious as to what is going to happen with the final volume. Will it have a case or not? A few months ago I contacted the publishers about this and was told that there will indeed be a 26th volume and final box set next year. However, there has been no official word yet from the publishers so this morning I contacted again concerning the same matter and was told once again that there will be a 26th volume. This time I was given a bit more info as well. Here was there response:(Cut and pasted)Due to collector demands we're publishing a 26th volume of material yet to be determined and there will be a boxed set for 25 & 26 at the end of 2016.Our pr dept. gave me this bit of information that will be apart of promotion starting next year. "Complete Peanuts fans: although the strip has been collected, we have one more volume up our sleeve for next fall, collecting a treasure trove of Schulz rarities, from his initial Peanuts pitch packet, to several comic book stories, advertising art, two major, never-before published interviews, and many other surprises!"

I had this game on my phone through Google and instantly loved it but I try not to play games on my mobile and at the time it wasn't available on Amazon. I only just learned that it was and was very excited about it. I quickly downloaded it and an enjoying the game all over again. Great Game!

One of the very best games ever! I paid for this game and its expansions as they originally came out and worth every penny. I'm reviewing this version simply to try and help those having trouble installing the game. Originally there were no issues downloading the app on my phone but later proved to be impossible until being advised to remove the memory card out of my phone while the app installs. If you do that you will have no issues installing the app to your phone. Once installed you can reinstall your memory card and still be able to play the game just fine. I hope this works for those having issues because this is a great game!

There are many tower defense games but few are as good as this one. I'm sure the sequels are even better but this was alone far exceeded my expectations. It is challenging enough to give you a real sense of achievement but not difficult to the point where you feel like just giving up.  My only issue is that at times it does kick me out of the game. Luckily that only happens from the home screen never in battle. I'm looking forward to more. Luckily I own all three of the ones available.

I have had this app for well over a year now here on Amazon and have completed ask the available packs. You get two packs for free. The rest you must purchase for 99 each. My only gripe was the there were packs available on Google Play but not here and after contacting the developer found out those packs were not going to be available either.Now, through Amazon Underground, I can enjoy this game once again and for free. Not only this it include the same pack as before but also those that were not available before. One happy customer!In this game you have to fill all the enjoy pockets. You must used everything in order for it to count. Great game!
Try to untangle everything in the proper order. Gets more difficult as you progress but definitely worth your time. Very relaxing.

I've been wanting to play this game but reviews kept me away. I've been playing this game on my phone and enjoying it.Basically you try to get your characters to the trapped one without dying. I know it's not saying much but the tutorial is good. I was confused at first but that was because I tried playing without reading the tutorial. Overall it's a great game worth having.

I just found this app and it quickly drew my attention seeing that I own physical blocks like these that I enjoy even though it has been a while since I've tried them.Anyway, the app itself is very good and unique to app world. At least I've never seen it done before. There are four rooms with nine puzzles each (hopefully more on the way) in which it's our goal to separate the pieces. Using logic and a lot of thought we have to do this before unlocking the next puzzle. This will work until the third level in the second room after which point you will have to pay a small price of 99 for the remaining puzzles should you choose to.You are being timed and depending on your speed and amount of moves to solve each puzzle you are rated one, two or three stars. The music is perfect for the app and graphics are good as well and easy on the eyes. If, like me, you enjoy brain testing games this is definitely one to get.

I wish we had an official YouTube app for Kindle Fires but at the moment there isn't. I decided to try this one and after a month of using I've seen this to be a really good substitute. There are ads but that's okay.What I enjoy most is that I can log into my account and see my playlist and add to them as well. Videos are really clear and perfect to watch cartoons and music videos.I rated it three because it tend to freeze often while searching for videos and going back to the home page. I have had to force stop it at times so it can revert back to normal. Overall is still a great substitute.

The game is easy enough to learn. Just connect each shape together with its own kind from beginning to end without crossing lines. The first and last are marked.It starts out easy but quickly becomes tricky as obstacles begin to be presented. Layout and sound are great. Easy on the eyes and a game which will undoubtedly offer hours of game play. Of course, I love games like this one.

The idea being the game is a good one but the execution is flawed. First, there is no easy way to gain pick axes and they are needed for many things.Second, each chore keeps the person handling it stuck there until it is completed. Normally that is not necessarily a bad thing since there are two others you can work with but when you plant crops it becomes an issue. You would think that each harvest process will be counted as a chore as a whole but that is not the case. Each plot is a chore itself. So if you plant twelve potatoes, for instance, which take two hours to grow you will have to wait two hours in between plots before you can move on to the next. The maximum amount of plots that can be done at once it's three before being asked to purchase more help which cost gold which is hard to come by.Third, there are constant pop ups asking you to purchase gold, pick axes and other resources. All in all I do not recommend it. It started okay so I have it a chance but definitely not a game I would recommend.

The developers did a great job with the animation and graphics in this game. This is definitely not your typical game like many others offered new in the market.I like the fact that there are quests in the game as it gives me something to look forward to. There are many 'lands' you can unlock as well as creatures through clay coins that are earned based on how many you squash during play. Overall it is an enjoyable game and one I would recommend.

What separates this one from Candy Crush, Jelly Splash, Juice Fruit and most of these type of games is that this one appeals more to boys. Instead of candy, jelly or fruits we have monsters!Unless I'm much mistaken this is the only one that considers the male gender a bit more. While I've played them all I'll be more inclined to play this one for that reason. Each monster has its own unique ability to destroy when using the power ups abilities. Stones, electricity, water, fire, wind and poison. The different abilities make it more fun and versatile. It seems to contain many levels and some you have special challenges. All in all it is a great game with great graphics.

This one starts out easy enough but quickly starts getting more difficult to make you think ahead.If you're one enjoys games that require stimulating the brain this is for you. Similar to sudoku, crossme and the like this game does require thinking things carefully because while you're giving one set of colors you can very well be messing another set.On the left hand side you have a picture of colored circles and on the right you have your posting field. You have to make that match the picture. You either slide the entire row or column at once. You can't select individual circles which makes it all the more challenging.It's a nice clean looking app and the music is not bad either. Overall it seems like a great game to have on your device. Kudos the developers.

If you enjoy Flappy Wings and similar games you will be sure to enjoy this one as well. Like the other reviewer said it is a very similar concept except instead of going between the pipes without touching them out falling we are going from cloud to cloud without falling into the water and avoiding the shark or electric eels.The very cloud will drop so you need to get off them asap and if the clouds are far from each other just continue tapping while in the air and a parachute opens to allow to reach the next cloud.I like the retro feel to it between graphics and music. Overall it is a very decent game that has replay value.

This has been one of the best free apps available in a long time!You guide the planes to land, unload, fuel, load and take off... There may be more to do in some airplanes. The challenge comes in that you want to keep them happy in your airport and they will prove hard than it seems.You want to create as many color combos as possible to boost your earnings so you may have to paint since along the way. The Harper they are and the faster you get them back out the better your score.The levels are scored in two ways: goal level, master, perfect and others I cannot remember right now. This in turn takes you to the second format which is in the star feature. Four stars is the best you can do and it won't be easy to achieve that. That is where it becomes addicting. If like me you need the perfect scores you will find yourself playing the same level repeatedly until you achieve it. You can purchase items with your earned money to help you do better.Great graphics, color, music, sound.... everything about this app is just great! I love it!

After seeing all the raving reviews I decided to give it a try but I was very disappointed. It is a good premise but the game moves slowly and just not enough in it to keep me entertained for long and I'm not fond of the so called humor in it. I guess it's not for everyone.

As the dog days of summer wind down, Wendy Francis' The Summer of Good Intentions is the perfect book to read at the beach or on the porch.A family reunites to spend their annual July vacation at their summer home on Cape Cod. Maggie is mom to three, married to a great guy, and the organizer of the family. Jess is a high school principal, struggling to balance her demanding job, her children and a husband who is more interested in his job than his family. Virgie is the single one, a career-driven reporter trying to get a job as a TV news anchor and just staring a promising relationship.Their parents have recently divorced, and their mother Gloria is bringing her new boyfriend to the house. This makes their dad, Arthur, a mystery book writer, very sad as he doesn't understand why their marriage fell apart.Maggie fears that her life will become empty as her children get older and need her less. She wants to bring a foster child into the family but must first convince her husband. Jess' marriage woes have led her to place that could destroy her marriage and Virgie's work stresses have made her physically ill.I just fell into this story, reading it in two sittings. The sibling relationships felt so real, and the story of the three marriages facing different challenges was so engrossing. I felt like I was in the family vacation home, watching these people interact around me.We are privy to the secrets and feelings that each character has, and just like in life, things happen that can bring people together or tear them apart. Wendy Francis brings to life this interesting family, one just like our own, and she does so with heart and compassion that we can't help but want them to be happy even as the sad things that life inevitably brings each us do their best to bring us down.This is the second book I have read that features a character who is a hoarder (the other being Mary Pflum Peterson's upcoming memoir White Dresses), and it has given me more compassion for people who suffer from this disorder and for the family members who try to deal with them and the physical and emotional mess they leave behind.I loved The Summer of Good Intentions, and give it my highest recommendation. If you've ever sat on the beach talking with your sisters, this is the book for you.

The one blurb that publishers want on their novel is "Better than Gone Girl!", which is getting a little ubiquitous lately. I'm not a big suspense fan, and Gone Girl wasn't my favorite book, but I have read other books compared to it, like The Girl On The Train.Jessica Knoll's suspenseful novel Luckiest Girl Alive even has 'girl' in the title. It begins with Ani FaNelli shopping for items to put on her bridal registry. She picks up a Wustof knife and wonders how it would feel if she slid into her fiance's stomach.Something is off about Ani. She has a fabulous job at a woman's magazine (think Cosmo), and is engaged to a great catch, a man with a great job and who is socially connected. But there is something in Ani's past, something that happened when she was in high school.Ani grew up on the wrong side of the tracks outside Philadelphia. Her mother wanted Ani to meet the right people and so sent her daughter to Bradley, a private high school for blue bloods. Ani didn't fit in at first, she sat at the misfits' table at lunch.Until one day, she caught the eye of one of the popular guys at school. Soon she was eating lunch with the cool kids and even attending their parties where, of course, everyone was drinking.Something bad happened at Bradley, and the reader is not told what. A documentary crew wants to interview Ani about the incident, but Ani's fiance doesn't want her to do the interview. What exactly happened?The reader is given clues, but when we finally find out what happened, about halfway through the book, the story really takes off. I have to admit that up until that revelation, I was not really taken with the story. But once we get to the incident, Knoll's writing is so tight and tense, I felt like I didn't take a breath for the entire chapter.I have to admit, I guessed wrong as to what really happened, and so the surprise was shocking, even though as we got closer to the reveal, there are clues given if you want to pick them up.Knoll's characters are well developed, and anyone who went to high school (which is most of us) felt many of the things Ani did- isolated, fearful of not fitting in, and hoping to make friends. Knoll taps into those feelings so well.Ani has problems, and in the early chapters when she talks about her sexual desires, I admit to thinking that maybe this book just isn't for me. But I'm glad I continued on, because I was rewarded with a nail-biting story. Ani has to look inside herself to discover who she really wants to be, and her journey to get there is fascinating.I liked Luckiest Girl Alive better than Gone Girl and better than The Girl On The Train, because Jessica Knoll does a great job of creating suspense and empathy for a troubled character. And even after reading it awhile ago, just thinking about now it is giving me heart palpitations and a dry mouth.

Jenny is a hardworking doctor, married to a successful surgeon and mother to three teenagers. Her fifteen-year-old daughter Naomi has been acting distant lately, which bothers Jenny since they have always been close. She attributes it to all the pressures of school, working hard on the school play and just normal teenage angst.Then one night Jenny doesn't come home from play rehearsal. Jenny and Ted call her friends, drive around the town, and still no Naomi. Shemilt captures the raw fear and panic of realizing that your child is missing. Any parent reading it will have a visceral reaction to this story.The story is told in alternating time lines, from the day she disappears and then one year later, with Naomi still gone and no answers from the police. Writing it this way made the story stronger for me, knowing that Naomi hasn't been found allows the reader to concentrate on the emotions of the family, rather than the actual search for Naomi.Naomi's disappearance reveals many secrets about Jenny's family. She discovers that the things she believes to be true about her marriage and her children aren't necessarily so. Naomi hid many things from her mother, and one thing you find from reading The Daughter is that you may think you know everything about your children, but they may have an entirely different life than the one you think they do.Watching Jenny suffer through her daughter's disappearance is tough. She tries to get through each day, wondering where her daughter is and what happened to her. Then there are the reactions of her two sons; as time goes on, she discovers things about them she never thought possible.I'm not sure how I feel about the resolution to the story. It is definitely one that will engender conversation and controversy. One of our members said she felt it fell flat at the end, and she wasn't crazy about the characters.The Daughter is a suspense thriller that does make a good book club pick because it will have people, especially mothers of teenagers, talking. It provokes strong reactions, and as a mother to sons, I wonder if I have a different reaction than mothers of daughters.

Some books just grab you right away, and I can add Matthew Quick's Love May Fail to that list. It begins with a card that reads:Portia Kane, Official Member of the Human Race! This card entitles you to the ugliness and beauty, heartache and joy- the great highs and lows of existence- and everything in between. It also guarantees you the right to strive, to reach, to dream, and to become the person you know (deep down) you are meant to be. So make daring choices, work hard, enjoy the ride, and remember- you  become exactly whomever you choose to be.Then we jump into the first chapter where Portia Kane is hiding in her bedroom closet with a gun, ready to catch her pornographer husband red-handed in the act of cheating on her. Portia ponders how she got there. She used to be a feminist, but as she says,"Being a feminist is so easy when you're a college freshman with enough scholarship money and financial aid to cover tuition, room and board. A woman with a clean slate. Compromises come with age."The scene between Portia and her husband, (with a very young naked woman also in the mix) is just funny and crazy and brilliantly written. My favorite line happens when Portia tells the young woman exactly what she is in for sexually with Ken, and as she is throwing her clothes into a weekend bag, she thinks, "Naked Ken watches me with his mouth hanging open, like I just invented fire." That one just had me laughing out loud.Portia gets on a plane to go home to her hoarder mother. She sits next to a nun, who offers her an ear and some vodka, even though Portia has already got a good start on getting drunk. Portia spills her guts to Sister Maeve, who is a real pistol herself.
